 If left blank the following patterns are tested: <code>*.c</code>, <code>*.cc</code>, <code>*.cxx</code>, <code>*.cxxm</code>, <code>*.cpp</code>, <code>*.cppm</code>, <code>*.ccm</code>, <code>*.c++</code>, <code>*.c++m</code>, <code>*.java</code>, <code>*.ii</code>, <code>*.ixx</code>, <code>*.ipp</code>, <code>*.i++</code>, <code>*.inl</code>, <code>*.idl</code>, <code>*.ddl</code>, <code>*.odl</code>, <code>*.h</code>, <code>*.hh</code>, <code>*.hxx</code>, <code>*.hpp</code>, <code>*.h++</code>, <code>*.l</code>, <code>*.cs</code>, <code>*.d</code>, <code>*.php</code>, <code>*.php4</code>, <code>*.php5</code>, <code>*.phtml</code>, <code>*.inc</code>, <code>*.m</code>, <code>*.markdown</code>, <code>*.md</code>, <code>*.mm</code>, <code>*.dox</code> (to be provided as Doxygen C comment), <code>*.py</code>, <code>*.pyw</code>, <code>*.f90</code>, <code>*.f95</code>, <code>*.f03</code>, <code>*.f08</code>, <code>*.f18</code>, <code>*.f</code>, <code>*.for</code>, <code>*.vhd</code>, <code>*.vhdl</code>, <code>*.ucf</code>, <code>*.qsf</code> and <code>*.ice</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_recursive"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>RECURSIVE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a132_RECURSIVE" name="a132_RECURSIVE"></a> The <code>RECURSIVE</code> tag can be used to specify whether or not subdirectories should be searched for input files as well.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_exclude"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXCLUDE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a133_EXCLUDE" name="a133_EXCLUDE"></a> The <code>EXCLUDE</code> tag can be used to specify files and/or directories that should be excluded from the <a class="el" href="#cfg_input">INPUT</a> source files. This way you can easily exclude a subdirectory from a directory tree whose root is specified with the <a class="el" href="#cfg_input">INPUT</a> tag. <br  />
Note that relative paths are relative to the directory from which Doxygen is run.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_exclude_symlinks"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXCLUDE_SYMLINKS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a134_EXCLUDE_5FSYMLINKS" name="a134_EXCLUDE_5FSYMLINKS"></a> The <code>EXCLUDE_SYMLINKS</code> tag can be used to select whether or not files or directories that are symbolic links (a Unix file system feature) are excluded from the input.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_exclude_patterns"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXCLUDE_PATTERNS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a135_EXCLUDE_5FPATTERNS" name="a135_EXCLUDE_5FPATTERNS"></a> If the value of the <a class="el" href="#cfg_input">INPUT</a> tag contains directories, you can use the <code>EXCLUDE_PATTERNS</code> tag to specify one or more wildcard patterns to exclude certain files from those directories. <br  />
Note that the wildcards are matched against the file with absolute path, so to exclude all test directories for example use the pattern <span class="tt">*</span><span class="tt">/test/</span><span class="tt">*</span></p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_exclude_symbols"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXCLUDE_SYMBOLS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a136_EXCLUDE_5FSYMBOLS" name="a136_EXCLUDE_5FSYMBOLS"></a> The <code>EXCLUDE_SYMBOLS</code> tag can be used to specify one or more symbol names (namespaces, classes, functions, etc.) that should be excluded from the output. The symbol name can be a fully qualified name, a word, or if the wildcard <span class="tt">*</span> is used, a substring. Examples: <span class="tt">ANamespace</span>, <span class="tt">AClass</span>, <span class="tt">ANamespace::AClass</span>, <span class="tt">ANamespace::*Test</span></p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_example_path"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXAMPLE_PATH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a137_EXAMPLE_5FPATH" name="a137_EXAMPLE_5FPATH"></a> The <code>EXAMPLE_PATH</code> tag can be used to specify one or more files or directories that contain example code fragments that are included (see the <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdinclude">\include</a> command).</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_example_patterns"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXAMPLE_PATTERNS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a138_EXAMPLE_5FPATTERNS" name="a138_EXAMPLE_5FPATTERNS"></a> If the value of the <a class="el" href="#cfg_example_path">EXAMPLE_PATH</a> tag contains directories, you can use the <code>EXAMPLE_PATTERNS</code> tag to specify one or more wildcard pattern (like <span class="tt">*.cpp</span> and <span class="tt">*.h</span>) to filter out the source-files in the directories. If left blank all files are included.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_example_recursive"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXAMPLE_RECURSIVE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a139_EXAMPLE_5FRECURSIVE" name="a139_EXAMPLE_5FRECURSIVE"></a> If the <code>EXAMPLE_RECURSIVE</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then subdirectories will be searched for input files to be used with the <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdinclude">\include</a> or <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmddontinclude">\dontinclude</a> commands irrespective of the value of the <a class="el" href="#cfg_recursive">RECURSIVE</a> tag.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_image_path"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>IMAGE_PATH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a140_IMAGE_5FPATH" name="a140_IMAGE_5FPATH"></a> The <code>IMAGE_PATH</code> tag can be used to specify one or more files or directories that contain images that are to be included in the documentation (see the <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdimage">\image</a> command).</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_input_filter"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>INPUT_FILTER</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a141_INPUT_5FFILTER" name="a141_INPUT_5FFILTER"></a> The <code>INPUT_FILTER</code> tag can be used to specify a program that Doxygen should invoke to filter for each input file. Doxygen will invoke the filter program by executing (via <code>popen()</code>) the command: <br  />
 <code>&lt;filter&gt; &lt;input-file&gt;</code> <br  />
 where <code>&lt;filter&gt;</code> is the value of the <code>INPUT_FILTER</code> tag, and <code>&lt;input-file&gt;</code> is the name of an input file. Doxygen will then use the output that the filter program writes to standard output. If <a class="el" href="#cfg_filter_patterns">FILTER_PATTERNS</a> is specified, this tag will be ignored. <br  />
Note that the filter must not add or remove lines; it is applied before the code is scanned, but not when the output code is generated. If lines are added or removed, the anchors will not be placed correctly. <br  />
Note that Doxygen will use the data processed and written to standard output for further processing, therefore nothing else, like debug statements or used commands (so in case of a Windows batch file always use <span class="tt">@echo OFF</span>), should be written to standard output. <br  />
Note that for custom extensions or not directly supported extensions you also need to set <a class="el" href="#cfg_extension_mapping">EXTENSION_MAPPING</a> for the extension otherwise the files are not properly processed by Doxygen.<br  />
</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_filter_patterns"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>FILTER_PATTERNS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a142_FILTER_5FPATTERNS" name="a142_FILTER_5FPATTERNS"></a> The <code>FILTER_PATTERNS</code> tag can be used to specify filters on a per file pattern basis. Doxygen will compare the file name with each pattern and apply the filter if there is a match. The filters are a list of the form: pattern=filter (like <span class="tt">*.cpp=my_cpp_filter</span>). See <a class="el" href="#cfg_input_filter">INPUT_FILTER</a> for further information on how filters are used. If the <code>FILTER_PATTERNS</code> tag is empty or if none of the patterns match the file name, <a class="el" href="#cfg_input_filter">INPUT_FILTER</a> is applied. <br  />
Note that for custom extensions or not directly supported extensions you also need to set <a class="el" href="#cfg_extension_mapping">EXTENSION_MAPPING</a> for the extension otherwise the files are not properly processed by Doxygen.<br  />
</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_filter_source_files"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>FILTER_SOURCE_FILES</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a143_FILTER_5FSOURCE_5FFILES" name="a143_FILTER_5FSOURCE_5FFILES"></a> If the <code>FILTER_SOURCE_FILES</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, the input filter (if set using <a class="el" href="#cfg_input_filter">INPUT_FILTER</a>) will also be used to filter the input files that are used for producing the source files to browse (i.e. when <a class="el" href="#cfg_source_browser">SOURCE_BROWSER</a> is set to <code>YES</code>).</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_filter_source_patterns"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>FILTER_SOURCE_PATTERNS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a144_FILTER_5FSOURCE_5FPATTERNS" name="a144_FILTER_5FSOURCE_5FPATTERNS"></a> The <code>FILTER_SOURCE_PATTERNS</code> tag can be used to specify source filters per file pattern. A pattern will override the setting for <a class="el" href="#cfg_filter_patterns">FILTER_PATTERN</a> (if any) and it is also possible to disable source filtering for a specific pattern using <span class="tt">*.ext=</span> (so without naming a filter).</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_filter_source_files">FILTER_SOURCE_FILES</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_use_mdfile_as_mainpage"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>USE_MDFILE_AS_MAINPAGE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a145_USE_5FMDFILE_5FAS_5FMAINPAGE" name="a145_USE_5FMDFILE_5FAS_5FMAINPAGE"></a> If the <code>USE_MDFILE_AS_MAINPAGE</code> tag refers to the name of a markdown file that is part of the input, its contents will be placed on the main page (<span class="tt">index.html</span>). This can be useful if you have a project on for instance GitHub and want to reuse the introduction page also for the Doxygen output.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_implicit_dir_docs"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>IMPLICIT_DIR_DOCS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a146_IMPLICIT_5FDIR_5FDOCS" name="a146_IMPLICIT_5FDIR_5FDOCS"></a> If the <code>IMPLICIT_DIR_DOCS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, any <span class="tt">README.md</span> file found in sub-directories of the project's root, is used as the documentation for that sub-directory, except when the <span class="tt">README.md</span> starts with a <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmddir">\dir</a>, <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdpage">\page</a> or <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdmainpage">\mainpage</a> command. If set to <code>NO</code>, the <span class="tt">README.md</span> file needs to start with an explicit <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmddir">\dir</a> command in order to be used as directory documentation.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_fortran_comment_after"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>FORTRAN_COMMENT_AFTER</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a147_FORTRAN_5FCOMMENT_5FAFTER" name="a147_FORTRAN_5FCOMMENT_5FAFTER"></a> The Fortran standard specifies that for fixed formatted Fortran code all characters from position 72 are to be considered as comment. A common extension is to allow longer lines before the automatic comment starts. The setting <code>FORTRAN_COMMENT_AFTER</code> will also make it possible that longer lines can be processed before the automatic comment starts.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>7</code>, maximum value: <code>10000</code>, default value: <code>72</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<h1 class="doxsection"><a class="anchor" id="config_source_browser"></a>
Configuration options related to source browsing</h1>
<p><a class="anchor" id="cfg_source_browser"></a></p><dl>
<dt><code>SOURCE_BROWSER</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a148_SOURCE_5FBROWSER" name="a148_SOURCE_5FBROWSER"></a> If the <code>SOURCE_BROWSER</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then a list of source files will be generated. Documented entities will be cross-referenced with these sources. <br  />
Note: To get rid of all source code in the generated output, make sure that also <a class="el" href="#cfg_verbatim_headers">VERBATIM_HEADERS</a> is set to <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_inline_sources"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>INLINE_SOURCES</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a149_INLINE_5FSOURCES" name="a149_INLINE_5FSOURCES"></a> Setting the <code>INLINE_SOURCES</code> tag to <code>YES</code> will include the body of functions, multi-line macros, enums or list initialized variables directly into the documentation.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_strip_code_comments"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>STRIP_CODE_COMMENTS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a150_STRIP_5FCODE_5FCOMMENTS" name="a150_STRIP_5FCODE_5FCOMMENTS"></a> Setting the <code>STRIP_CODE_COMMENTS</code> tag to <code>YES</code> will instruct Doxygen to hide any special comment blocks from generated source code fragments. Normal C, C++ and Fortran comments will always remain visible.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_referenced_by_relation"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>REFERENCED_BY_RELATION</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a151_REFERENCED_5FBY_5FRELATION" name="a151_REFERENCED_5FBY_5FRELATION"></a> If the <code>REFERENCED_BY_RELATION</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then for each documented entity all documented functions referencing it will be listed.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_references_relation"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>REFERENCES_RELATION</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a152_REFERENCES_5FRELATION" name="a152_REFERENCES_5FRELATION"></a> If the <code>REFERENCES_RELATION</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then for each documented function all documented entities called/used by that function will be listed.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_references_link_source"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>REFERENCES_LINK_SOURCE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a153_REFERENCES_5FLINK_5FSOURCE" name="a153_REFERENCES_5FLINK_5FSOURCE"></a> If the <code>REFERENCES_LINK_SOURCE</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_source_browser">SOURCE_BROWSER</a> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then the hyperlinks from functions in <a class="el" href="#cfg_references_relation">REFERENCES_RELATION</a> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_referenced_by_relation">REFERENCED_BY_RELATION</a> lists will link to the source code. Otherwise they will link to the documentation.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_source_tooltips"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>SOURCE_TOOLTIPS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a154_SOURCE_5FTOOLTIPS" name="a154_SOURCE_5FTOOLTIPS"></a> If <code>SOURCE_TOOLTIPS</code> is enabled (the default) then hovering a hyperlink in the source code will show a tooltip with additional information such as prototype, brief description and links to the definition and documentation. Since this will make the HTML file larger and loading of large files a bit slower, you can opt to disable this feature.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_source_browser">SOURCE_BROWSER</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_use_htags"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>USE_HTAGS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a155_USE_5FHTAGS" name="a155_USE_5FHTAGS"></a> If the <code>USE_HTAGS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then the references to source code will point to the HTML generated by the <code>htags(1)</code> tool instead of Doxygen built-in source browser. The <code>htags</code> tool is part of GNU's global source tagging system (see <a href="https://www.gnu.org/software/global/global.html">https://www.gnu.org/software/global/global.html</a>). You will need version 4.8.6 or higher. <br  />
 To use it do the following:</p><ol type="1">
<li>Install the latest version of <code>global</code> </li>
<li>Enable <a class="el" href="#cfg_source_browser">SOURCE_BROWSER</a> and <code>USE_HTAGS</code> in the configuration file</li>
<li>Make sure the <a class="el" href="#cfg_input">INPUT</a> points to the root of the source tree</li>
<li>Run <code>doxygen</code> as normal <br  />
 Doxygen will invoke <code>htags</code> (and that will in turn invoke <code>gtags</code>), so these tools must be available from the command line (i.e. in the search path). <br  />
 The result: instead of the source browser generated by Doxygen, the links to source code will now point to the output of <code>htags</code>.</li>
</ol>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_source_browser">SOURCE_BROWSER</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_verbatim_headers"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>VERBATIM_HEADERS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a156_VERBATIM_5FHEADERS" name="a156_VERBATIM_5FHEADERS"></a> If the <code>VERBATIM_HEADERS</code> tag is set the <code>YES</code> then Doxygen will generate a verbatim copy of the header file for each class for which an include is specified. Set to <code>NO</code> to disable this. </p><dl class="section see"><dt>See also</dt><dd>Section <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdclass">\class</a>.</dd></dl>
<p>The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_clang_assisted_parsing"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>CLANG_ASSISTED_PARSING</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a157_CLANG_5FASSISTED_5FPARSING" name="a157_CLANG_5FASSISTED_5FPARSING"></a> If the <code>CLANG_ASSISTED_PARSING</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen will use the <a href="http://clang.llvm.org/">clang parser</a> for more accurate parsing at the cost of reduced performance. This can be particularly helpful with template rich C++ code for which Doxygen's built-in parser lacks the necessary type information.</p>
<dl class="section note"><dt>Note</dt><dd>The availability of this option depends on whether or not Doxygen was generated with the <span class="tt">-Duse_libclang=ON</span> option for CMake.</dd></dl>
<p>The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_clang_add_inc_paths"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>CLANG_ADD_INC_PATHS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a158_CLANG_5FADD_5FINC_5FPATHS" name="a158_CLANG_5FADD_5FINC_5FPATHS"></a> If the <code>CLANG_ASSISTED_PARSING</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> and the <code>CLANG_ADD_INC_PATHS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen will add the directory of each input to the include path.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_clang_assisted_parsing">CLANG_ASSISTED_PARSING</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_clang_options"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>CLANG_OPTIONS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a159_CLANG_5FOPTIONS" name="a159_CLANG_5FOPTIONS"></a> If clang assisted parsing is enabled you can provide the compiler with command line options that you would normally use when invoking the compiler. Note that the include paths will already be set by Doxygen for the files and directories specified with <a class="el" href="#cfg_input">INPUT</a> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_include_path">INCLUDE_PATH</a>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_clang_assisted_parsing">CLANG_ASSISTED_PARSING</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_clang_database_path"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>CLANG_DATABASE_PATH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a160_CLANG_5FDATABASE_5FPATH" name="a160_CLANG_5FDATABASE_5FPATH"></a> If clang assisted parsing is enabled you can provide the clang parser with the path to the directory containing a file called <span class="tt">compile_commands.json</span>. This file is the <a href="http://clang.llvm.org/docs/HowToSetupToolingForLLVM.html">compilation database</a> containing the options used when the source files were built. This is equivalent to specifying the <span class="tt">-p</span> option to a clang tool, such as <span class="tt">clang-check</span>. These options will then be passed to the parser. Any options specified with <a class="el" href="#cfg_clang_options">CLANG_OPTIONS</a> will be added as well.</p>
<dl class="section note"><dt>Note</dt><dd>The availability of this option depends on whether or not Doxygen was generated with the <span class="tt">-Duse_libclang=ON</span> option for CMake.</dd></dl>
</dd>
</dl>
<h1 class="doxsection"><a class="anchor" id="config_index"></a>
Configuration options related to the alphabetical class index</h1>
<p><a class="anchor" id="cfg_alphabetical_index"></a></p><dl>
<dt><code>ALPHABETICAL_INDEX</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a161_ALPHABETICAL_5FINDEX" name="a161_ALPHABETICAL_5FINDEX"></a> If the <code>ALPHABETICAL_INDEX</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, an alphabetical index of all compounds will be generated. Enable this if the project contains a lot of classes, structs, unions or interfaces.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_ignore_prefix"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>IGNORE_PREFIX</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a162_IGNORE_5FPREFIX" name="a162_IGNORE_5FPREFIX"></a> The <code>IGNORE_PREFIX</code> tag can be used to specify a prefix (or a list of prefixes) that should be ignored while generating the index headers. The <code>IGNORE_PREFIX</code> tag works for classes, function and member names. The entity will be placed in the alphabetical list under the first letter of the entity name that remains after removing the prefix.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_alphabetical_index">ALPHABETICAL_INDEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
<h1 class="doxsection"><a class="anchor" id="config_html"></a>
Configuration options related to the HTML output</h1>
<p><a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_html"></a></p><dl>
<dt><code>GENERATE_HTML</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a163_GENERATE_5FHTML" name="a163_GENERATE_5FHTML"></a> If the <code>GENERATE_HTML</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will generate HTML output</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_output"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_OUTPUT</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a164_HTML_5FOUTPUT" name="a164_HTML_5FOUTPUT"></a> The <code>HTML_OUTPUT</code> tag is used to specify where the HTML docs will be put. If a relative path is entered the value of <a class="el" href="#cfg_output_directory">OUTPUT_DIRECTORY</a> will be put in front of it.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default directory is: <code>html</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_file_extension"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_FILE_EXTENSION</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a165_HTML_5FFILE_5FEXTENSION" name="a165_HTML_5FFILE_5FEXTENSION"></a> The <code>HTML_FILE_EXTENSION</code> tag can be used to specify the file extension for each generated HTML page (for example: <code>.htm, .php, .asp</code>).</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>.html</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_header"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_HEADER</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a166_HTML_5FHEADER" name="a166_HTML_5FHEADER"></a> The <code>HTML_HEADER</code> tag can be used to specify a user-defined HTML header file for each generated HTML page. If the tag is left blank Doxygen will generate a standard header. <br  />
 To get valid HTML the header file that includes any scripts and style sheets that Doxygen needs, which is dependent on the configuration options used (e.g. the setting <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_treeview">GENERATE_TREEVIEW</a>). It is highly recommended to start with a default header using </p><pre class="fragment">doxygen -w html new_header.html new_footer.html new_stylesheet.css YourConfigFile
</pre><p> and then modify the file <code>new_header.html</code>.</p>
<p class="interdd">See also section <a class="el" href="doxygen_usage.html">Doxygen usage</a> for information on how to generate the default header that Doxygen normally uses.</p>
<dl class="section note"><dt>Note</dt><dd>The header is subject to change so you typically have to regenerate the default header when upgrading to a newer version of Doxygen. The following markers have a special meaning inside the header and footer: <dl>
<dt><code>$title</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the title of the page. </dd>
<dt><code>$datetime</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the current date and time. </dd>
<dt><code>$date</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the current date. </dd>
<dt><code>$time</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the current time. </dd>
<dt><code>$year</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaces with the current year. </dd>
<dt><code>$showdate(&lt;format&gt;)</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the current date and time according to the format as specified by <span class="tt">&lt;format&gt;</span>. The <span class="tt">&lt;format&gt;</span> follows the rules as specified for the <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdshowdate">\showdate</a> command with the exception that no <span class="tt">)</span> is allowed in the <span class="tt">&lt;format&gt;</span>. </dd>
<dt><code>$doxygenversion</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the version of Doxygen </dd>
<dt><code>$projectname</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the name of the project (see <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_name">PROJECT_NAME</a>) </dd>
<dt><code>$projectnumber</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the project number (see <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_number">PROJECT_NUMBER</a>) </dd>
<dt><code>$projectbrief</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the project brief description (see <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_brief">PROJECT_BRIEF</a>) </dd>
<dt><code>$projectlogo</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the project logo (see <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_logo">PROJECT_LOGO</a>) </dd>
<dt><code>$generatedby</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the output language dependent version of the text "Generated by" or when the <a class="el" href="#cfg_timestamp">TIMESTAMP</a> is set by the output language dependent version of the text &quot;Generated on <span class="tt">$datetime</span> for <span class="tt">$projectname</span> by&quot;. </dd>
<dt><code>$stylesheet</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the setting of <a class="el" href="#cfg_html_stylesheet">HTML_STYLESHEET</a> unless it is empty or the file in which case it is replaced by the default setting <span class="tt">doxygen.css</span>. </dd>
<dt><code>$extrastylesheet</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the setting of <a class="el" href="#cfg_html_extra_stylesheet">HTML_EXTRA_STYLESHEET</a> including the required HTML tags for each extra stylesheet. </dd>
<dt><code>$treeview</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with links to the JavaScript and style sheets needed for the navigation tree (or an empty string when <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_treeview">GENERATE_TREEVIEW</a> is disabled). </dd>
<dt><code>$search</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with a links to the JavaScript and style sheets needed for the search engine (or an empty string when <a class="el" href="#cfg_searchengine">SEARCHENGINE</a> is disabled). </dd>
<dt><code>$searchbox</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the HTML code needed for the search box to be shown (or an empty string when <a class="el" href="#cfg_searchengine">SEARCHENGINE</a> is disabled). </dd>
<dt><code>$mathjax</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with a links to the JavaScript and style sheets needed for the MathJax feature (or an empty string when <a class="el" href="#cfg_use_mathjax">USE_MATHJAX</a> is disabled). </dd>
<dt><code>$relpath^</code></dt>
<dd>If <a class="el" href="#cfg_create_subdirs">CREATE_SUBDIRS</a> is enabled, the command <code>$relpath^</code> can be used to produce a relative path to the root of the HTML output directory, e.g. use <code>$relpath^doxygen.css</code>, to refer to the standard style sheet. </dd>
<dt><code>$navpath</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with a path as required by <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_treeview">GENERATE_TREEVIEW</a> </dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>
<p>To cope with differences in the layout of the header and footer that depend on configuration settings, the header can also contain special blocks that will be copied to the output or skipped depending on the configuration. Such blocks have the following form: </p><pre class="fragment"> &lt;!--BEGIN BLOCKNAME--&gt;
 Some context copied when condition BLOCKNAME holds
 &lt;!--END BLOCKNAME--&gt;
 &lt;!--BEGIN !BLOCKNAME--&gt;
 Some context copied when condition BLOCKNAME does not hold
 &lt;!--END !BLOCKNAME--&gt;
</pre><p> The following block names are supported: </p><dl>
<dt><code>DISABLE_INDEX</code></dt>
<dd>Content within this block is copied to the output if the <a class="el" href="#cfg_disable_index">DISABLE_INDEX</a> option is enabled (so when the index is disabled). </dd>
<dt><code>GENERATE_TREEVIEW</code></dt>
<dd>Content within this block is copied to the output if the <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_treeview">GENERATE_TREEVIEW</a> option is enabled. </dd>
<dt><code>SEARCHENGINE</code></dt>
<dd>Content within this block is copied to the output if the <a class="el" href="#cfg_searchengine">SEARCHENGINE</a> option is enabled. </dd>
<dt><code>PROJECT_NAME</code></dt>
<dd>Content within the block is copied to the output if the <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_name">PROJECT_NAME</a> option is not empty. </dd>
<dt><code>PROJECT_NUMBER</code></dt>
<dd>Content within the block is copied to the output if the <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_number">PROJECT_NUMBER</a> option is not empty. </dd>
<dt><code>PROJECT_BRIEF</code></dt>
<dd>Content within the block is copied to the output if the <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_brief">PROJECT_BRIEF</a> option is not empty. </dd>
<dt><code>PROJECT_LOGO</code></dt>
<dd>Content within the block is copied to the output if the <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_logo">PROJECT_LOGO</a> option is not empty. </dd>
<dt><code>FULL_SIDEBAR</code></dt>
<dd>Content within the block is copied to the output if the <a class="el" href="#cfg_full_sidebar">FULL_SIDEBAR</a>, <a class="el" href="#cfg_disable_index">DISABLE_INDEX</a> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_treeview">GENERATE_TREEVIEW</a> options are all enabled. </dd>
<dt><code>TITLEAREA</code></dt>
<dd>Content within this block is copied to the output if a title is visible at the top of each page. This is the case if either <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_name">PROJECT_NAME</a>, <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_brief">PROJECT_BRIEF</a>, <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_logo">PROJECT_LOGO</a> is filled in or if both <a class="el" href="#cfg_disable_index">DISABLE_INDEX</a> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_searchengine">SEARCHENGINE</a> are enabled. </dd>
</dl>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_footer"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_FOOTER</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a167_HTML_5FFOOTER" name="a167_HTML_5FFOOTER"></a> The <code>HTML_FOOTER</code> tag can be used to specify a user-defined HTML footer for each generated HTML page. If the tag is left blank Doxygen will generate a standard footer.</p>
<p class="interdd">See <a class="el" href="#cfg_html_header">HTML_HEADER</a> for more information on how to generate a default footer and what special commands can be used inside the footer.</p>
<p class="interdd">See also section <a class="el" href="doxygen_usage.html">Doxygen usage</a> for information on how to generate the default footer that Doxygen normally uses.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_stylesheet"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_STYLESHEET</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a168_HTML_5FSTYLESHEET" name="a168_HTML_5FSTYLESHEET"></a> The <code>HTML_STYLESHEET</code> tag can be used to specify a user-defined cascading style sheet that is used by each HTML page. It can be used to fine-tune the look of the HTML output. If left blank Doxygen will generate a default style sheet.</p>
<p class="interdd">See also section <a class="el" href="doxygen_usage.html">Doxygen usage</a> for information on how to generate the style sheet that Doxygen normally uses.</p>
<dl class="section note"><dt>Note</dt><dd>It is recommended to use <a class="el" href="#cfg_html_extra_stylesheet">HTML_EXTRA_STYLESHEET</a> instead of this tag, as it is more robust and this tag (<code>HTML_STYLESHEET</code>) will in the future become obsolete.</dd></dl>
<p>This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_extra_stylesheet"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_EXTRA_STYLESHEET</code> </dt>
<dd><a id="a169_HTML_5FEXTRA_5FSTYLESHEET" name="a169_HTML_5FEXTRA_5FSTYLESHEET"></a> The <code>HTML_EXTRA_STYLESHEET</code> tag can be used to specify additional user-defined cascading style sheets that are included after the standard style sheets created by Doxygen. Using this option one can overrule certain style aspects. This is preferred over using <a class="el" href="#cfg_html_stylesheet">HTML_STYLESHEET</a> since it does not replace the standard style sheet and is therefore more robust against future updates. Doxygen will copy the style sheet files to the output directory. <dl class="section note"><dt>Note</dt><dd>The order of the extra style sheet files is of importance (e.g. the last style sheet in the list overrules the setting of the previous ones in the list). </dd>
<dd>
Since the styling of scrollbars can currently not be overruled in Webkit/Chromium, the styling will be left out of the default doxygen.css if one or more extra stylesheets have been specified. So if scrollbar customization is desired it has to be added explicitly. Here is an example style sheet that gives the contents area a fixed width: <pre class="fragment">body {
        background-color: #CCC;
        color: black;
        margin: 0;
}

div.contents {
        margin-bottom: 10px;
        padding: 12px;
        margin-left: auto;
        margin-right: auto;
        width: 960px;
        background-color: white;
        border-radius: 8px;
}

#titlearea {
        background-color: white;
}

hr.footer {
        display: none;
}

.footer {
        background-color: #AAA;
}
</pre></dd></dl>
This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_extra_files"></a></dd>
<dt><code>HTML_EXTRA_FILES</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a170_HTML_5FEXTRA_5FFILES" name="a170_HTML_5FEXTRA_5FFILES"></a> The <code>HTML_EXTRA_FILES</code> tag can be used to specify one or more extra images or other source files which should be copied to the HTML output directory. Note that these files will be copied to the base HTML output directory. Use the <code>$relpath^</code> marker in the <a class="el" href="#cfg_html_header">HTML_HEADER</a> and/or <a class="el" href="#cfg_html_footer">HTML_FOOTER</a> files to load these files. In the <a class="el" href="#cfg_html_stylesheet">HTML_STYLESHEET</a> file, use the file name only. Also note that the files will be copied as-is; there are no commands or markers available.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_colorstyle"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_COLORSTYLE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a171_HTML_5FCOLORSTYLE" name="a171_HTML_5FCOLORSTYLE"></a> The <code>HTML_COLORSTYLE</code> tag can be used to specify if the generated HTML output should be rendered with a dark or light theme.</p>
<p class="interdd">Possible values are: <code>LIGHT</code> always generates light mode output, <code>DARK</code> always generates dark mode output, <code>AUTO_LIGHT</code> automatically sets the mode according to the user preference, uses light mode if no preference is set (the default), <code>AUTO_DARK</code> automatically sets the mode according to the user preference, uses dark mode if no preference is set and <code>TOGGLE</code> allows a user to switch between light and dark mode via a button.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>AUTO_LIGHT</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_colorstyle_hue"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_COLORSTYLE_HUE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a172_HTML_5FCOLORSTYLE_5FHUE" name="a172_HTML_5FCOLORSTYLE_5FHUE"></a> The <code>HTML_COLORSTYLE_HUE</code> tag controls the color of the HTML output. Doxygen will adjust the colors in the style sheet and background images according to this color. Hue is specified as an angle on a color-wheel, see <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hue">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hue</a> for more information. For instance the value 0 represents red, 60 is yellow, 120 is green, 180 is cyan, 240 is blue, 300 purple, and 360 is red again.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>0</code>, maximum value: <code>359</code>, default value: <code>220</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_colorstyle_sat"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_COLORSTYLE_SAT</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a173_HTML_5FCOLORSTYLE_5FSAT" name="a173_HTML_5FCOLORSTYLE_5FSAT"></a> The <code>HTML_COLORSTYLE_SAT</code> tag controls the purity (or saturation) of the colors in the HTML output. For a value of 0 the output will use gray-scales only. A value of 255 will produce the most vivid colors.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>0</code>, maximum value: <code>255</code>, default value: <code>100</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_colorstyle_gamma"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_COLORSTYLE_GAMMA</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a174_HTML_5FCOLORSTYLE_5FGAMMA" name="a174_HTML_5FCOLORSTYLE_5FGAMMA"></a> The <code>HTML_COLORSTYLE_GAMMA</code> tag controls the gamma correction applied to the luminance component of the colors in the HTML output. Values below 100 gradually make the output lighter, whereas values above 100 make the output darker. The value divided by 100 is the actual gamma applied, so 80 represents a gamma of 0.8, The value 220 represents a gamma of 2.2, and 100 does not change the gamma.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>40</code>, maximum value: <code>240</code>, default value: <code>80</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_dynamic_menus"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_DYNAMIC_MENUS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a175_HTML_5FDYNAMIC_5FMENUS" name="a175_HTML_5FDYNAMIC_5FMENUS"></a> If the <code>HTML_DYNAMIC_MENUS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then the generated HTML documentation will contain a main index with vertical navigation menus that are dynamically created via JavaScript. If disabled, the navigation index will consists of multiple levels of tabs that are statically embedded in every HTML page. Disable this option to support browsers that do not have JavaScript, like the Qt help browser.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_dynamic_sections"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_DYNAMIC_SECTIONS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a176_HTML_5FDYNAMIC_5FSECTIONS" name="a176_HTML_5FDYNAMIC_5FSECTIONS"></a> If the <code>HTML_DYNAMIC_SECTIONS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then the generated HTML documentation will contain sections that can be hidden and shown after the page has loaded.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_code_folding"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_CODE_FOLDING</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a177_HTML_5FCODE_5FFOLDING" name="a177_HTML_5FCODE_5FFOLDING"></a> If the <code>HTML_CODE_FOLDING</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then classes and functions can be dynamically folded and expanded in the generated HTML source code.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_copy_clipboard"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_COPY_CLIPBOARD</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a178_HTML_5FCOPY_5FCLIPBOARD" name="a178_HTML_5FCOPY_5FCLIPBOARD"></a> If the <code>HTML_COPY_CLIPBOARD</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen will show an icon in the top right corner of code and text fragments that allows the user to copy its content to the clipboard. Note this only works if supported by the browser and the web page is served via a <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/secure-contexts/">secure context</a>, i.e. using the https: or file: protocol.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_project_cookie"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_PROJECT_COOKIE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a179_HTML_5FPROJECT_5FCOOKIE" name="a179_HTML_5FPROJECT_5FCOOKIE"></a> Doxygen stores a couple of settings persistently in the browser (via e.g. cookies). By default these settings apply to all HTML pages generated by Doxygen across all projects. The <code>HTML_PROJECT_COOKIE</code> tag can be used to store the settings under a project specific key, such that the user preferences will be stored separately.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_index_num_entries"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_INDEX_NUM_ENTRIES</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a180_HTML_5FINDEX_5FNUM_5FENTRIES" name="a180_HTML_5FINDEX_5FNUM_5FENTRIES"></a> With <code>HTML_INDEX_NUM_ENTRIES</code> one can control the preferred number of entries shown in the various tree structured indices initially; the user can expand and collapse entries dynamically later on. Doxygen will expand the tree to such a level that at most the specified number of entries are visible (unless a fully collapsed tree already exceeds this amount). So setting the number of entries 1 will produce a full collapsed tree by default. 0 is a special value representing an infinite number of entries and will result in a full expanded tree by default.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>0</code>, maximum value: <code>9999</code>, default value: <code>100</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_docset"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>GENERATE_DOCSET</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a181_GENERATE_5FDOCSET" name="a181_GENERATE_5FDOCSET"></a> If the <code>GENERATE_DOCSET</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, additional index files will be generated that can be used as input for <a href="https://developer.apple.com/xcode/">Apple's Xcode 3 integrated development environment</a>, introduced with OSX 10.5 (Leopard). To create a documentation set, Doxygen will generate a Makefile in the HTML output directory. Running <code>make</code> will produce the docset in that directory and running <code>make install</code> will install the docset in <code>~/Library/Developer/Shared/Documentation/DocSets</code> so that Xcode will find it at startup. See <a href="https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/featuredarticles/DoxygenXcode/_index.html">https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/featuredarticles/DoxygenXcode/_index.html</a> for more information.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_docset_feedname"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOCSET_FEEDNAME</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a182_DOCSET_5FFEEDNAME" name="a182_DOCSET_5FFEEDNAME"></a> This tag determines the name of the docset feed. A documentation feed provides an umbrella under which multiple documentation sets from a single provider (such as a company or product suite) can be grouped.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>Doxygen generated docs</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_docset">GENERATE_DOCSET</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_docset_feedurl"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOCSET_FEEDURL</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a183_DOCSET_5FFEEDURL" name="a183_DOCSET_5FFEEDURL"></a> This tag determines the URL of the docset feed. A documentation feed provides an umbrella under which multiple documentation sets from a single provider (such as a company or product suite) can be grouped.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_docset">GENERATE_DOCSET</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_docset_bundle_id"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOCSET_BUNDLE_ID</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a184_DOCSET_5FBUNDLE_5FID" name="a184_DOCSET_5FBUNDLE_5FID"></a> This tag specifies a string that should uniquely identify the documentation set bundle. This should be a reverse domain-name style string, e.g. <code>com.mycompany.MyDocSet</code>. Doxygen will append <code>.docset</code> to the name.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>org.doxygen.Project</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_docset">GENERATE_DOCSET</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_docset_publisher_id"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOCSET_PUBLISHER_ID</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a185_DOCSET_5FPUBLISHER_5FID" name="a185_DOCSET_5FPUBLISHER_5FID"></a> The <code>DOCSET_PUBLISHER_ID</code> tag specifies a string that should uniquely identify the documentation publisher. This should be a reverse domain-name style string, e.g. <code>com.mycompany.MyDocSet.documentation</code>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>org.doxygen.Publisher</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_docset">GENERATE_DOCSET</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_docset_publisher_name"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOCSET_PUBLISHER_NAME</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a186_DOCSET_5FPUBLISHER_5FNAME" name="a186_DOCSET_5FPUBLISHER_5FNAME"></a> The <code>DOCSET_PUBLISHER_NAME</code> tag identifies the documentation publisher.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>Publisher</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_docset">GENERATE_DOCSET</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_htmlhelp"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>GENERATE_HTMLHELP</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a187_GENERATE_5FHTMLHELP" name="a187_GENERATE_5FHTMLHELP"></a> If the <code>GENERATE_HTMLHELP</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen generates three additional HTML index files: <code>index.hhp</code>, <code>index.hhc</code>, and <code>index.hhk</code>. The <code>index.hhp</code> is a project file that can be read by Microsoft's HTML Help Workshop on Windows. In the beginning of 2021 Microsoft took the original page, with a.o. the download links, offline (the HTML help workshop was already many years in maintenance mode). You can download the HTML help workshop from the web archives at <a href="http://web.archive.org/web/20160201063255/http://download.microsoft.com/download/0/A/9/0A939EF6-E31C-430F-A3DF-DFAE7960D564/htmlhelp.exe">Installation executable</a>. <br  />
 The HTML Help Workshop contains a compiler that can convert all HTML output generated by Doxygen into a single compiled HTML file (<span class="tt">.chm</span>). Compiled HTML files are now used as the Windows 98 help format, and will replace the old Windows help format (<span class="tt">.hlp</span>) on all Windows platforms in the future. Compressed HTML files also contain an index, a table of contents, and you can search for words in the documentation. The HTML workshop also contains a viewer for compressed HTML files.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_chm_file"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>CHM_FILE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a188_CHM_5FFILE" name="a188_CHM_5FFILE"></a> The <code>CHM_FILE</code> tag can be used to specify the file name of the resulting <span class="tt">.chm</span> file. You can add a path in front of the file if the result should not be written to the html output directory.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_htmlhelp">GENERATE_HTMLHELP</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_hhc_location"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HHC_LOCATION</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a189_HHC_5FLOCATION" name="a189_HHC_5FLOCATION"></a> The <code>HHC_LOCATION</code> tag can be used to specify the location (absolute path including file name) of the HTML help compiler (<code>hhc.exe</code>). If non-empty, Doxygen will try to run the HTML help compiler on the generated <code>index.hhp</code>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The file has to be specified with full path.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_htmlhelp">GENERATE_HTMLHELP</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_chi"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>GENERATE_CHI</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a190_GENERATE_5FCHI" name="a190_GENERATE_5FCHI"></a> The <code>GENERATE_CHI</code> flag controls if a separate <span class="tt">.chi</span> index file is generated (<code>YES</code>) or that it should be included in the main <span class="tt">.chm</span> file (<code>NO</code>).</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_htmlhelp">GENERATE_HTMLHELP</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_chm_index_encoding"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>CHM_INDEX_ENCODING</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a191_CHM_5FINDEX_5FENCODING" name="a191_CHM_5FINDEX_5FENCODING"></a> The <code>CHM_INDEX_ENCODING</code> is used to encode HtmlHelp index (<code>hhk</code>), content (<code>hhc</code>) and project file content.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_htmlhelp">GENERATE_HTMLHELP</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_binary_toc"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>BINARY_TOC</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a192_BINARY_5FTOC" name="a192_BINARY_5FTOC"></a> The <code>BINARY_TOC</code> flag controls whether a binary table of contents is generated (<code>YES</code>) or a normal table of contents (<code>NO</code>) in the <span class="tt">.chm</span> file. Furthermore it enables the <span class="tt">Previous</span> and <span class="tt">Next</span> buttons.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_htmlhelp">GENERATE_HTMLHELP</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_toc_expand"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>TOC_EXPAND</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a193_TOC_5FEXPAND" name="a193_TOC_5FEXPAND"></a> The <code>TOC_EXPAND</code> flag can be set to <code>YES</code> to add extra items for group members to the table of contents of the HTML help documentation and to the tree view.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_htmlhelp">GENERATE_HTMLHELP</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_sitemap_url"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>SITEMAP_URL</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a194_SITEMAP_5FURL" name="a194_SITEMAP_5FURL"></a> The <code>SITEMAP_URL</code> tag is used to specify the full URL of the place where the generated documentation will be placed on the server by the user during the deployment of the documentation. The generated sitemap is called <span class="tt">sitemap.xml</span> and placed on the directory specified by <a class="el" href="#cfg_html_output">HTML_OUTPUT</a>. In case no <code>SITEMAP_URL</code> is specified no sitemap is generated. For information about the sitemap protocol see <a href="https://www.sitemaps.org">https://www.sitemaps.org</a></p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_qhp"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>GENERATE_QHP</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a195_GENERATE_5FQHP" name="a195_GENERATE_5FQHP"></a> If the <code>GENERATE_QHP</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> and both <a class="el" href="#cfg_qhp_namespace">QHP_NAMESPACE</a> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_qhp_virtual_folder">QHP_VIRTUAL_FOLDER</a> are set, an additional index file will be generated that can be used as input for Qt's qhelpgenerator to generate a Qt Compressed Help (<span class="tt">.qch</span>) of the generated HTML documentation.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_qch_file"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>QCH_FILE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a196_QCH_5FFILE" name="a196_QCH_5FFILE"></a> If the <a class="el" href="#cfg_qhg_location">QHG_LOCATION</a> tag is specified, the <code>QCH_FILE</code> tag can be used to specify the file name of the resulting <span class="tt">.qch</span> file. The path specified is relative to the HTML output folder.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_qhp">GENERATE_QHP</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_qhp_namespace"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>QHP_NAMESPACE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a197_QHP_5FNAMESPACE" name="a197_QHP_5FNAMESPACE"></a> The <code>QHP_NAMESPACE</code> tag specifies the namespace to use when generating Qt Help Project output. For more information please see <a href="https://doc.qt.io/archives/qt-4.8/qthelpproject.html#namespace">Qt Help Project / Namespace</a>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>org.doxygen.Project</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_qhp">GENERATE_QHP</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_qhp_virtual_folder"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>QHP_VIRTUAL_FOLDER</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a198_QHP_5FVIRTUAL_5FFOLDER" name="a198_QHP_5FVIRTUAL_5FFOLDER"></a> The <code>QHP_VIRTUAL_FOLDER</code> tag specifies the namespace to use when generating Qt Help Project output. For more information please see <a href="https://doc.qt.io/archives/qt-4.8/qthelpproject.html#virtual-folders">Qt Help Project / Virtual Folders</a>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>doc</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_qhp">GENERATE_QHP</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_qhp_cust_filter_name"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>QHP_CUST_FILTER_NAME</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a199_QHP_5FCUST_5FFILTER_5FNAME" name="a199_QHP_5FCUST_5FFILTER_5FNAME"></a> If the <code>QHP_CUST_FILTER_NAME</code> tag is set, it specifies the name of a custom filter to add. For more information please see <a href="https://doc.qt.io/archives/qt-4.8/qthelpproject.html#custom-filters">Qt Help Project / Custom Filters</a>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_qhp">GENERATE_QHP</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_qhp_cust_filter_attrs"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>QHP_CUST_FILTER_ATTRS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a200_QHP_5FCUST_5FFILTER_5FATTRS" name="a200_QHP_5FCUST_5FFILTER_5FATTRS"></a> The <code>QHP_CUST_FILTER_ATTRS</code> tag specifies the list of the attributes of the custom filter to add. For more information please see <a href="https://doc.qt.io/archives/qt-4.8/qthelpproject.html#custom-filters">Qt Help Project / Custom Filters</a>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_qhp">GENERATE_QHP</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_qhp_sect_filter_attrs"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>QHP_SECT_FILTER_ATTRS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a201_QHP_5FSECT_5FFILTER_5FATTRS" name="a201_QHP_5FSECT_5FFILTER_5FATTRS"></a> The <code>QHP_SECT_FILTER_ATTRS</code> tag specifies the list of the attributes this project's filter section matches. <a href="https://doc.qt.io/archives/qt-4.8/qthelpproject.html#filter-attributes">Qt Help Project / Filter Attributes</a>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_qhp">GENERATE_QHP</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_qhg_location"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>QHG_LOCATION</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a202_QHG_5FLOCATION" name="a202_QHG_5FLOCATION"></a> The <code>QHG_LOCATION</code> tag can be used to specify the location (absolute path including file name) of Qt's qhelpgenerator. If non-empty Doxygen will try to run qhelpgenerator on the generated <span class="tt">.qhp</span> file.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_qhp">GENERATE_QHP</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_eclipsehelp"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>GENERATE_ECLIPSEHELP</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a203_GENERATE_5FECLIPSEHELP" name="a203_GENERATE_5FECLIPSEHELP"></a> If the <code>GENERATE_ECLIPSEHELP</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, additional index files will be generated, together with the HTML files, they form an <span class="tt">Eclipse</span> help plugin.</p>
<p class="interdd">To install this plugin and make it available under the help contents menu in <span class="tt">Eclipse</span>, the contents of the directory containing the HTML and XML files needs to be copied into the plugins directory of eclipse. The name of the directory within the plugins directory should be the same as the <a class="el" href="#cfg_eclipse_doc_id">ECLIPSE_DOC_ID</a> value.</p>
<p class="interdd">After copying <span class="tt">Eclipse</span> needs to be restarted before the help appears.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_eclipse_doc_id"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>ECLIPSE_DOC_ID</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a204_ECLIPSE_5FDOC_5FID" name="a204_ECLIPSE_5FDOC_5FID"></a> A unique identifier for the <span class="tt">Eclipse</span> help plugin. When installing the plugin the directory name containing the HTML and XML files should also have this name. Each documentation set should have its own identifier.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>org.doxygen.Project</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_eclipsehelp">GENERATE_ECLIPSEHELP</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_disable_index"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DISABLE_INDEX</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a205_DISABLE_5FINDEX" name="a205_DISABLE_5FINDEX"></a> If you want full control over the layout of the generated HTML pages it might be necessary to disable the index and replace it with your own. The <code>DISABLE_INDEX</code> tag can be used to turn on/off the condensed index (tabs) at top of each HTML page. A value of <code>NO</code> enables the index and the value <code>YES</code> disables it. Since the tabs in the index contain the same information as the navigation tree, you can set this option to <code>YES</code> if you also set <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_treeview">GENERATE_TREEVIEW</a> to <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_treeview"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>GENERATE_TREEVIEW</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a206_GENERATE_5FTREEVIEW" name="a206_GENERATE_5FTREEVIEW"></a> The <code>GENERATE_TREEVIEW</code> tag is used to specify whether a tree-like index structure should be generated to display hierarchical information. If the tag value is set to <code>YES</code>, a side panel will be generated containing a tree-like index structure (just like the one that is generated for HTML Help). For this to work a browser that supports JavaScript, DHTML, CSS and frames is required (i.e. any modern browser). Windows users are probably better off using the HTML help feature.</p>
<p class="interdd">Via custom style sheets (see <a class="el" href="#cfg_html_extra_stylesheet">HTML_EXTRA_STYLESHEET</a>) one can further fine tune the look of the index (see <a class="el" href="doxygen_usage.html#doxygen_finetune">Fine-tuning the output</a>). As an example, the default style sheet generated by Doxygen has an example that shows how to put an image at the root of the tree instead of the <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_name">PROJECT_NAME</a>.</p>
<p class="interdd">Since the tree basically has more details information than the tab index, you could consider setting <a class="el" href="#cfg_disable_index">DISABLE_INDEX</a> to <code>YES</code> when enabling this option.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_page_outline_panel"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>PAGE_OUTLINE_PANEL</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a207_PAGE_5FOUTLINE_5FPANEL" name="a207_PAGE_5FOUTLINE_5FPANEL"></a> When <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_treeview">GENERATE_TREEVIEW</a> is set to <code>YES</code>, the <code>PAGE_OUTLINE_PANEL</code> option determines if an additional navigation panel is shown at the right hand side of the screen, displaying an outline of the contents of the main page, similar to e.g. <a href="https://developer.android.com/reference">https://developer.android.com/reference</a></p>
<p class="interdd">If <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_treeview">GENERATE_TREEVIEW</a> is set to <code>NO</code>, this option has no effect.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_full_sidebar"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>FULL_SIDEBAR</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a208_FULL_5FSIDEBAR" name="a208_FULL_5FSIDEBAR"></a> When <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_treeview">GENERATE_TREEVIEW</a> is set to <code>YES</code>, the <code>FULL_SIDEBAR</code> option determines if the side bar is limited to only the treeview area (value <code>NO</code>) or if it should extend to the full height of the window (value <code>YES</code>). Setting this to <code>YES</code> gives a layout similar to e.g. <a href="https://docs.readthedocs.io">https://docs.readthedocs.io</a> with more room for contents, but less room for the project logo, title, and description.</p>
<p class="interdd">If <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_treeview">GENERATE_TREEVIEW</a> is set to <code>NO</code>, this option has no effect.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_enum_values_per_line"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>ENUM_VALUES_PER_LINE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a209_ENUM_5FVALUES_5FPER_5FLINE" name="a209_ENUM_5FVALUES_5FPER_5FLINE"></a> The <code>ENUM_VALUES_PER_LINE</code> tag can be used to set the number of enum values that Doxygen will group on one line in the generated HTML documentation. <br  />
Note that a value of 0 will completely suppress the enum values from appearing in the overview section.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>0</code>, maximum value: <code>20</code>, default value: <code>4</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_show_enum_values"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>SHOW_ENUM_VALUES</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a210_SHOW_5FENUM_5FVALUES" name="a210_SHOW_5FENUM_5FVALUES"></a> When the <code>SHOW_ENUM_VALUES</code> tag is set doxygen will show the specified enumeration values besides the enumeration mnemonics.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_treeview_width"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>TREEVIEW_WIDTH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a211_TREEVIEW_5FWIDTH" name="a211_TREEVIEW_5FWIDTH"></a> If the treeview is enabled (see <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_treeview">GENERATE_TREEVIEW</a>) then this tag can be used to set the initial width (in pixels) of the frame in which the tree is shown.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>0</code>, maximum value: <code>1500</code>, default value: <code>250</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_ext_links_in_window"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXT_LINKS_IN_WINDOW</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a212_EXT_5FLINKS_5FIN_5FWINDOW" name="a212_EXT_5FLINKS_5FIN_5FWINDOW"></a> If the <code>EXT_LINKS_IN_WINDOW</code> option is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will open links to external symbols imported via tag files in a separate window.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_obfuscate_emails"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>OBFUSCATE_EMAILS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a213_OBFUSCATE_5FEMAILS" name="a213_OBFUSCATE_5FEMAILS"></a> If the <code>OBFUSCATE_EMAILS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will obfuscate email addresses.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_html_formula_format"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HTML_FORMULA_FORMAT</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a214_HTML_5FFORMULA_5FFORMAT" name="a214_HTML_5FFORMULA_5FFORMAT"></a> If the <code>HTML_FORMULA_FORMAT</code> option is set to <code>svg</code>, Doxygen will use the pdf2svg tool (see <a href="https://github.com/dawbarton/pdf2svg">https://github.com/dawbarton/pdf2svg</a>) or inkscape (see <a href="https://inkscape.org">https://inkscape.org</a>) to generate formulas as SVG images instead of PNGs for the HTML output. These images will generally look nicer at scaled resolutions.</p>
<p class="interdd">Possible values are: <code>png</code> (the default) and <code>svg</code> (looks nicer but requires the pdf2svg or inkscape tool).</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>png</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_formula_fontsize"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>FORMULA_FONTSIZE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a215_FORMULA_5FFONTSIZE" name="a215_FORMULA_5FFONTSIZE"></a> Use this tag to change the font size of <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> formulas included as images in the HTML documentation. When you change the font size after a successful Doxygen run you need to manually remove any <span class="tt">form_*.png</span> images from the HTML output directory to force them to be regenerated.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>8</code>, maximum value: <code>50</code>, default value: <code>10</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_formula_macrofile"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>FORMULA_MACROFILE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a216_FORMULA_5FMACROFILE" name="a216_FORMULA_5FMACROFILE"></a> The <code>FORMULA_MACROFILE</code> can contain <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> <span class="tt">\newcommand</span> and <span class="tt">\renewcommand</span> commands to create new <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> commands to be used in formulas as building blocks. See the section <a class="el" href="formulas.html">Including formulas</a> for details.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_use_mathjax"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>USE_MATHJAX</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a217_USE_5FMATHJAX" name="a217_USE_5FMATHJAX"></a> Enable the <code>USE_MATHJAX</code> option to render <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> formulas using MathJax (see <a href="https://www.mathjax.org">https://www.mathjax.org</a>) which uses client side JavaScript for the rendering instead of using pre-rendered bitmaps. Use this if you do not have <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> installed or if you want to formulas look prettier in the HTML output. When enabled you may also need to install MathJax separately and configure the path to it using the <a class="el" href="#cfg_mathjax_relpath">MATHJAX_RELPATH</a> option.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_mathjax_version"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>MATHJAX_VERSION</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a218_MATHJAX_5FVERSION" name="a218_MATHJAX_5FVERSION"></a> With <code>MATHJAX_VERSION</code> it is possible to specify the MathJax version to be used. Note that the different versions of MathJax have different requirements with regards to the different settings, so it is possible that also other MathJax settings have to be changed when switching between the different MathJax versions.</p>
<p class="interdd">Possible values are: <code>MathJax_2</code> and <code>MathJax_3</code>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>MathJax_2</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_use_mathjax">USE_MATHJAX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_mathjax_format"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>MATHJAX_FORMAT</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a219_MATHJAX_5FFORMAT" name="a219_MATHJAX_5FFORMAT"></a> When MathJax is enabled you can set the default output format to be used for the MathJax output. For more details about the output format see <a href="http://docs.mathjax.org/en/v2.7-latest/output.html">MathJax version 2</a> and <a href="http://docs.mathjax.org/en/latest/web/components/output.html">MathJax version 3</a>.</p>
<p class="interdd">Possible values are: <code>HTML-CSS</code> (which is slower, but has the best compatibility. This is the name for Mathjax version 2, for MathJax version 3 this will be translated into <code>chtml</code>), <code>NativeMML</code> (i.e. MathML. Only supported for MathJax 2. For MathJax version 3 <code>chtml</code> will be used instead.), <code>chtml</code> (This is the name for Mathjax version 3, for MathJax version 2 this will be translated into <code>HTML-CSS</code>) and <code>SVG</code>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>HTML-CSS</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_use_mathjax">USE_MATHJAX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_mathjax_relpath"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>MATHJAX_RELPATH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a220_MATHJAX_5FRELPATH" name="a220_MATHJAX_5FRELPATH"></a> When MathJax is enabled you need to specify the location relative to the HTML output directory using the <code>MATHJAX_RELPATH</code> option. The destination directory should contain the <span class="tt">MathJax.js</span> script. For instance, if the <code>mathjax</code> directory is located at the same level as the HTML output directory, then <code>MATHJAX_RELPATH</code> should be <code>../mathjax</code>. The default value points to the MathJax Content Delivery Network so you can quickly see the result without installing MathJax. However, it is strongly recommended to install a local copy of MathJax from <a href="https://www.mathjax.org">https://www.mathjax.org</a> before deployment.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is:</p><ul>
<li>in case of MathJax version 2: <a href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/mathjax@2">https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/mathjax@2</a></li>
<li>in case of MathJax version 3: <a href="https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/mathjax@3">https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/mathjax@3</a></li>
</ul>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_use_mathjax">USE_MATHJAX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_mathjax_extensions"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>MATHJAX_EXTENSIONS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a221_MATHJAX_5FEXTENSIONS" name="a221_MATHJAX_5FEXTENSIONS"></a> The <code>MATHJAX_EXTENSIONS</code> tag can be used to specify one or more MathJax extension names that should be enabled during MathJax rendering. For example for MathJax version 2 (see <a href="https://docs.mathjax.org/en/v2.7-latest/tex.html#tex-and-latex-extensions">https://docs.mathjax.org/en/v2.7-latest/tex.html#tex-and-latex-extensions</a>): </p><pre class="fragment">MATHJAX_EXTENSIONS     = TeX/AMSmath TeX/AMSsymbols
</pre><p> For example for MathJax version 3 (see <a href="http://docs.mathjax.org/en/latest/input/tex/extensions/index.html">http://docs.mathjax.org/en/latest/input/tex/extensions/index.html</a>): </p><pre class="fragment">MATHJAX_EXTENSIONS     = ams
</pre><p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_use_mathjax">USE_MATHJAX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_mathjax_codefile"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>MATHJAX_CODEFILE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a222_MATHJAX_5FCODEFILE" name="a222_MATHJAX_5FCODEFILE"></a> The <code>MATHJAX_CODEFILE</code> tag can be used to specify a file with JavaScript pieces of code that will be used on startup of the MathJax code. See <a href="http://docs.mathjax.org/en/v2.7-latest/output.html">the MathJax site</a> for more details. As an example to disable the "Math Renderer" menu item in the "Math
 Settings" menu of MathJax: </p><pre class="fragment">MATHJAX_CODEFILE = disableRenderer.js
</pre><p> with in the file <code>disableRenderer.js</code>: </p><pre class="fragment">  MathJax.Hub.Config({
   menuSettings: {
    showRenderer: false,
   }
  });
</pre><p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_use_mathjax">USE_MATHJAX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_searchengine"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>SEARCHENGINE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a223_SEARCHENGINE" name="a223_SEARCHENGINE"></a> When the <code>SEARCHENGINE</code> tag is enabled Doxygen will generate a search box for the HTML output. The underlying search engine uses JavaScript and DHTML and should work on any modern browser. Note that when using HTML help (<a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_htmlhelp">GENERATE_HTMLHELP</a>), Qt help (<a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_qhp">GENERATE_QHP</a>), or docsets (<a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_docset">GENERATE_DOCSET</a>) there is already a search function so this one should typically be disabled. For large projects the JavaScript based search engine can be slow, then enabling <a class="el" href="#cfg_server_based_search">SERVER_BASED_SEARCH</a> may provide a better solution.</p>
