<p class="interdd">It is possible to search using the keyboard; to jump to the search box use <code>&lt;access key&gt; + S</code> (what the <code>&lt;access key&gt;</code> is depends on the OS and browser, but it is typically <code>&lt;CTRL&gt;</code>, <code>&lt;ALT&gt;</code>/<code>&lt;option&gt;</code>, or both). Inside the search box use the <code>&lt;cursor down key&gt;</code> to jump into the search results window, the results can be navigated using the <code>&lt;cursor keys&gt;</code>. Press <code>&lt;Enter&gt;</code> to select an item or <code>&lt;escape&gt;</code> to cancel the search. The filter options can be selected when the cursor is inside the search box by pressing <code>&lt;Shift&gt;+&lt;cursor down&gt;</code>. Also here use the <code>&lt;cursor keys&gt;</code> to select a filter and <code>&lt;Enter&gt;</code> or <code>&lt;escape&gt;</code> to activate or cancel the filter option.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_html">GENERATE_HTML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_server_based_search"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>SERVER_BASED_SEARCH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a224_SERVER_5FBASED_5FSEARCH" name="a224_SERVER_5FBASED_5FSEARCH"></a> When the <code>SERVER_BASED_SEARCH</code> tag is enabled the search engine will be implemented using a web server instead of a web client using JavaScript.</p>
<p class="interdd">There are two flavors of web server based searching depending on the <a class="el" href="#cfg_external_search">EXTERNAL_SEARCH</a> setting. When disabled, Doxygen will generate a PHP script for searching and an index file used by the script. When <a class="el" href="#cfg_external_search">EXTERNAL_SEARCH</a> is enabled the indexing and searching needs to be provided by external tools. See the section <a class="el" href="extsearch.html">External Indexing and Searching</a> for details.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_searchengine">SEARCHENGINE</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_external_search"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXTERNAL_SEARCH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a225_EXTERNAL_5FSEARCH" name="a225_EXTERNAL_5FSEARCH"></a> When <code>EXTERNAL_SEARCH</code> tag is enabled Doxygen will no longer generate the PHP script for searching. Instead the search results are written to an XML file which needs to be processed by an external indexer. Doxygen will invoke an external search engine pointed to by the <a class="el" href="#cfg_searchengine_url">SEARCHENGINE_URL</a> option to obtain the search results. <br  />
Doxygen ships with an example indexer (<code>doxyindexer</code>) and search engine (<code>doxysearch.cgi</code>) which are based on the open source search engine library <a href="https://xapian.org/">Xapian</a>. <br  />
See the section <a class="el" href="extsearch.html">External Indexing and Searching</a> for details.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_searchengine">SEARCHENGINE</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_searchengine_url"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>SEARCHENGINE_URL</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a226_SEARCHENGINE_5FURL" name="a226_SEARCHENGINE_5FURL"></a> The <code>SEARCHENGINE_URL</code> should point to a search engine hosted by a web server which will return the search results when <a class="el" href="#cfg_external_search">EXTERNAL_SEARCH</a> is enabled. <br  />
Doxygen ships with an example indexer (<code>doxyindexer</code>) and search engine (<code>doxysearch.cgi</code>) which are based on the open source search engine library <a href="https://xapian.org/">Xapian</a>. See the section <a class="el" href="extsearch.html">External Indexing and Searching</a> for details.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_searchengine">SEARCHENGINE</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_searchdata_file"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>SEARCHDATA_FILE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a227_SEARCHDATA_5FFILE" name="a227_SEARCHDATA_5FFILE"></a> When <a class="el" href="#cfg_server_based_search">SERVER_BASED_SEARCH</a> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_external_search">EXTERNAL_SEARCH</a> are both enabled the unindexed search data is written to a file for indexing by an external tool. With the <code>SEARCHDATA_FILE</code> tag the name of this file can be specified.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default file is: <code>searchdata.xml</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_searchengine">SEARCHENGINE</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_external_search_id"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXTERNAL_SEARCH_ID</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a228_EXTERNAL_5FSEARCH_5FID" name="a228_EXTERNAL_5FSEARCH_5FID"></a> When <a class="el" href="#cfg_server_based_search">SERVER_BASED_SEARCH</a> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_external_search">EXTERNAL_SEARCH</a> are both enabled the <code>EXTERNAL_SEARCH_ID</code> tag can be used as an identifier for the project. This is useful in combination with <a class="el" href="#cfg_extra_search_mappings">EXTRA_SEARCH_MAPPINGS</a> to search through multiple projects and redirect the results back to the right project.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_searchengine">SEARCHENGINE</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_extra_search_mappings"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXTRA_SEARCH_MAPPINGS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a229_EXTRA_5FSEARCH_5FMAPPINGS" name="a229_EXTRA_5FSEARCH_5FMAPPINGS"></a> The <code>EXTRA_SEARCH_MAPPINGS</code> tag can be used to enable searching through Doxygen projects other than the one defined by this configuration file, but that are all added to the same external search index. Each project needs to have a unique id set via <a class="el" href="#cfg_external_search_id">EXTERNAL_SEARCH_ID</a>. The search mapping then maps the id of to a relative location where the documentation can be found.</p>
<p class="interdd">The format is: </p><pre class="fragment">EXTRA_SEARCH_MAPPINGS = tagname1=loc1 tagname2=loc2 ...
</pre><p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_searchengine">SEARCHENGINE</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
<h1 class="doxsection"><a class="anchor" id="config_latex"></a>
Configuration options related to the LaTeX output</h1>
<p><a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_latex"></a></p><dl>
<dt><code>GENERATE_LATEX</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a230_GENERATE_5FLATEX" name="a230_GENERATE_5FLATEX"></a> If the <code>GENERATE_LATEX</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will generate <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> output.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_latex_output"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>LATEX_OUTPUT</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a231_LATEX_5FOUTPUT" name="a231_LATEX_5FOUTPUT"></a> The <code>LATEX_OUTPUT</code> tag is used to specify where the <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> docs will be put. If a relative path is entered the value of <a class="el" href="#cfg_output_directory">OUTPUT_DIRECTORY</a> will be put in front of it.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default directory is: <code>latex</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_latex_cmd_name"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>LATEX_CMD_NAME</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a232_LATEX_5FCMD_5FNAME" name="a232_LATEX_5FCMD_5FNAME"></a> The <code>LATEX_CMD_NAME</code> tag can be used to specify the <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> command name to be invoked. <br  />
Note that when not enabling <a class="el" href="#cfg_use_pdflatex">USE_PDFLATEX</a> the default is <code>latex</code> when enabling <a class="el" href="#cfg_use_pdflatex">USE_PDFLATEX</a> the default is <code>pdflatex</code> and when in the later case <code>latex</code> is chosen this is overwritten by <code>pdflatex</code>. For specific output languages the default can have been set differently, this depends on the implementation of the output language.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_makeindex_cmd_name"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>MAKEINDEX_CMD_NAME</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a233_MAKEINDEX_5FCMD_5FNAME" name="a233_MAKEINDEX_5FCMD_5FNAME"></a> The <code>MAKEINDEX_CMD_NAME</code> tag can be used to specify the command name to generate index for <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/>.</p>
<dl class="section note"><dt>Note</dt><dd>This tag is used in the <span class="tt">Makefile</span> / <span class="tt">make.bat</span>. </dd></dl>
<dl class="section see"><dt>See also</dt><dd><a class="el" href="#cfg_latex_makeindex_cmd">LATEX_MAKEINDEX_CMD</a> for the part in the generated output file (<span class="tt">.tex</span>).</dd></dl>
<p>The default file is: <code>makeindex</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_latex_makeindex_cmd"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>LATEX_MAKEINDEX_CMD</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a234_LATEX_5FMAKEINDEX_5FCMD" name="a234_LATEX_5FMAKEINDEX_5FCMD"></a> The <code>LATEX_MAKEINDEX_CMD</code> tag can be used to specify the command name to generate index for <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/>. In case there is no backslash (<span class="tt">\</span>) as first character it will be automatically added in the <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> code.</p>
<dl class="section note"><dt>Note</dt><dd>This tag is used in the generated output file (<span class="tt">.tex</span>). </dd></dl>
<dl class="section see"><dt>See also</dt><dd><a class="el" href="#cfg_makeindex_cmd_name">MAKEINDEX_CMD_NAME</a> for the part in the <span class="tt">Makefile</span> / <span class="tt">make.bat</span>.</dd></dl>
<p>The default value is: <code>makeindex</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_compact_latex"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>COMPACT_LATEX</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a235_COMPACT_5FLATEX" name="a235_COMPACT_5FLATEX"></a> If the <code>COMPACT_LATEX</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen generates more compact <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> documents. This may be useful for small projects and may help to save some trees in general.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_paper_type"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>PAPER_TYPE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a236_PAPER_5FTYPE" name="a236_PAPER_5FTYPE"></a> The <code>PAPER_TYPE</code> tag can be used to set the paper type that is used by the printer.</p>
<p class="interdd">Possible values are: <code>a4</code> (210 x 297 mm), <code>letter</code> (8.5 x 11 inches), <code>legal</code> (8.5 x 14 inches) and <code>executive</code> (7.25 x 10.5 inches).</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>a4</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_extra_packages"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXTRA_PACKAGES</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a237_EXTRA_5FPACKAGES" name="a237_EXTRA_5FPACKAGES"></a> The <code>EXTRA_PACKAGES</code> tag can be used to specify one or more <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> package names that should be included in the <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> output. The package can be specified just by its name or with the correct syntax as to be used with the <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> <span class="tt">\usepackage</span> command.</p>
<p class="interdd">To get the <span class="tt">times</span> font for instance you can specify : </p><pre class="fragment">  EXTRA_PACKAGES=times
or
  EXTRA_PACKAGES={times}
</pre><p> To use the option <span class="tt">intlimits</span> with the <span class="tt">amsmath</span> package you can specify: </p><pre class="fragment">   EXTRA_PACKAGES=[intlimits]{amsmath}
</pre><p> If left blank no extra packages will be included.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_latex_header"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>LATEX_HEADER</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a238_LATEX_5FHEADER" name="a238_LATEX_5FHEADER"></a> The <code>LATEX_HEADER</code> tag can be used to specify a user-defined <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> header for the generated <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> document. The header should contain everything until the first chapter. If it is left blank Doxygen will generate a standard header.</p>
<p class="interdd">It is highly recommended to start with a default header using </p><pre class="fragment">doxygen -w latex new_header.tex new_footer.tex new_stylesheet.sty
</pre><p> and then modify the file <code>new_header.tex</code>.</p>
<p class="interdd">See also section <a class="el" href="doxygen_usage.html">Doxygen usage</a> for information on how to generate the default header that Doxygen normally uses.</p>
<p class="interdd"><br  />
Note: Only use a user-defined header if you know what you are doing!</p>
<dl class="section note"><dt>Note</dt><dd>The header is subject to change so you typically have to regenerate the default header when upgrading to a newer version of Doxygen. The following commands have a special meaning inside the header (and footer): <dl>
<dt><code>$title</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the project name. </dd>
<dt><code>$datetime</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the current date and time. </dd>
<dt><code>$date</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the current date. </dd>
<dt><code>$time</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the current time. </dd>
<dt><code>$year</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaces with the current year. </dd>
<dt><code>$showdate(&lt;format&gt;)</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the current date and time according to the format as specified by <span class="tt">&lt;format&gt;</span>. The <span class="tt">&lt;format&gt;</span> follows the rules as specified for the <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdshowdate">\showdate</a> command with the exception that no <span class="tt">)</span> is allowed in the <span class="tt">&lt;format&gt;</span>. </dd>
<dt><code>$doxygenversion</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the version of Doxygen </dd>
<dt><code>$projectname</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the name of the project (see <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_name">PROJECT_NAME</a>) </dd>
<dt><code>$projectnumber</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the project number (see <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_number">PROJECT_NUMBER</a>) </dd>
<dt><code>$projectbrief</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the project brief description (see <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_brief">PROJECT_BRIEF</a>) </dd>
<dt><code>$projectlogo</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the project logo (see <a class="el" href="#cfg_project_logo">PROJECT_LOGO</a>) </dd>
<dt><code>$latexdocumentpre</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by an output language dependent setting e.g. embed the entire document in a special environment (for Chinese, Japanese etc.) Commonly used together with <span class="tt">$latexdocumentpost</span> in the footer. </dd>
<dt><code>$latexdocumentpost</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by an output language dependent setting e.g. embed the entire document in a special environment (for Chinese, Japanese etc.) Commonly used together with <span class="tt">$latexdocumentpre</span> in the header. </dd>
<dt><code>$generatedby</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the output language dependent version of the text "Generated by" or when the <a class="el" href="#cfg_timestamp">TIMESTAMP</a> is set by the output language dependent version of the text &quot;Generated on <span class="tt">$datetime</span> for <span class="tt">$projectname</span> by&quot;. </dd>
<dt><code>$latexcitereference</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by the output language dependent$ version of the word "Bibliography". This setting is typically used in combination with the block name <span class="tt">CITATIONS_PRESENT</span>. </dd>
<dt><code>$latexbibstyle</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced with the latex bib style to be used as set by <a class="el" href="#cfg_latex_bib_style">LATEX_BIB_STYLE</a>, in case nothing is set the bib style <span class="tt">plain</span> is used. This setting is typically used in combination with the block name <span class="tt">CITATIONS_PRESENT</span>. </dd>
<dt><code>$latexbibfiles</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by the comma separated list of <span class="tt">bib</span>. files as set by <a class="el" href="#cfg_cite_bib_files">CITE_BIB_FILES</a> (when necessary a missing <span class="tt">.bib</span> is automatically added). This setting is typically used in combination with the block name <span class="tt">CITATIONS_PRESENT</span>. </dd>
<dt><code>$papertype</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by the paper type as set in <a class="el" href="#cfg_paper_type">PAPER_TYPE</a> and the word "paper" is directly appended to it to have a correct <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> paper type. </dd>
<dt><code>$langISO</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by the ISO language name. </dd>
<dt><code>$languagesupport</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by an output language dependent setting of packages required for translating terms of the specified language. </dd>
<dt><code>$latexfontenc</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by an output language dependent setting of the fontencoding to be used. This setting is typically used in combination with the block name <span class="tt">LATEX_FONTENC</span>. </dd>
<dt><code>$latexfont</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by an output language dependent setting of the fonts to be used. </dd>
<dt><code>$latexemojidirectory</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by the directory as set in <a class="el" href="#cfg_latex_emoji_directory">LATEX_EMOJI_DIRECTORY</a> with the backslashes replaced by forward slashes (so usable by <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/>). In case the <a class="el" href="#cfg_latex_emoji_directory">LATEX_EMOJI_DIRECTORY</a> is empty, the current directory will be used. </dd>
<dt><code>$makeindex</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by the command as set in <a class="el" href="#cfg_latex_makeindex_cmd">LATEX_MAKEINDEX_CMD</a>. Then the command doesn't start with a backslash, a backslash is automatically prepended. In case the setting is empty the command <span class="tt">\makeindex</span> is used. </dd>
<dt><code>$extralatexpackages</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by commands for using the packages set in <a class="el" href="#cfg_extra_packages">EXTRA_PACKAGES</a>. </dd>
<dt><code>$extralatexstylesheet</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by commands for using the packages set in <a class="el" href="#cfg_latex_extra_stylesheet">LATEX_EXTRA_STYLESHEET</a> (when the extension is the default extension, <span class="tt">.sty</span>, this extension is stripped for the package name). </dd>
<dt><code>$latexspecialformulachars</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by the code for some special unicode characters that are commonly used (i.e. superscript minus, superscript 2 and superscript 3) </dd>
<dt><code>$formulamacrofile</code></dt>
<dd>will be replaced by the name of the file as set in <a class="el" href="#cfg_formula_macrofile">FORMULA_MACROFILE</a>. This setting is typically used in combination with the block name <span class="tt">FORMULA_MACROFILE</span>. </dd>
</dl>
</dd></dl>
<p>To cope with differences in the layout of the header and footer that depend on configuration settings, the header and footer can also contain special blocks that will be copied to the output or skipped depending on the configuration. Such blocks have the following form: </p><pre class="fragment"> %%BEGIN BLOCKNAME
 Some context copied when condition BLOCKNAME holds
 %%END BLOCKNAME
 %%BEGIN !BLOCKNAME
 Some context copied when condition BLOCKNAME does not hold
 %%END !BLOCKNAME
</pre><p> The following block names are set based on the used settings in the configuration file: </p><dl>
<dt><code>COMPACT_LATEX</code></dt>
<dd>Content within this block is copied to the output when the <a class="el" href="#cfg_compact_latex">COMPACT_LATEX</a> option is enabled. </dd>
<dt><code>PDF_HYPERLINKS</code></dt>
<dd>Content within this block is copied to the output when the <a class="el" href="#cfg_pdf_hyperlinks">PDF_HYPERLINKS</a> option is enabled. </dd>
<dt><code>USE_PDFLATEX</code></dt>
<dd>Content within this block is copied to the output when the <a class="el" href="#cfg_use_pdflatex">USE_PDFLATEX</a> option is enabled. </dd>
<dt><code>LATEX_BATCHMODE</code></dt>
<dd>Content within this block is copied to the output when the <a class="el" href="#cfg_latex_batchmode">LATEX_BATCHMODE</a> option is enabled. </dd>
<dt><code>TIMESTAMP</code></dt>
<dd>Content within this block is copied to the output when the <a class="el" href="#cfg_timestamp">TIMESTAMP</a> option is enabled. </dd>
</dl>
<p>The following block names are set based on the fact whether or not the tag has a value in the used configuration file: </p><dl>
<dt><code>LATEX_FONTENC</code></dt>
<dd>Content within this block is copied to the output when the Doxygen latex translator function returns a value for the font encoding to be used. It is to be used in combination with the above mentioned <span class="tt">$latexfontenc</span>. </dd>
<dt><code>FORMULA_MACROFILE</code></dt>
<dd>Content within this block is copied to the output when the <a class="el" href="#cfg_formula_macrofile">FORMULA_MACROFILE</a> option is not empty. It is to be used in combination with the above mentioned <span class="tt">$formulamacrofile</span>. </dd>
</dl>
<p>The following block name is set based on whether or not a feature is used in the documentation: </p><dl>
<dt><code>CITATIONS_PRESENT</code></dt>
<dd>Content within this block is copied to the output when in the documentation citations are present and the relevant .. are present. It is to be used in combination with the above mentioned <span class="tt">$latexcitereference</span>, <span class="tt">$latexbibstyle</span> and <span class="tt">$latexbibfiles</span>. </dd>
</dl>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_latex_footer"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>LATEX_FOOTER</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a239_LATEX_5FFOOTER" name="a239_LATEX_5FFOOTER"></a> The <code>LATEX_FOOTER</code> tag can be used to specify a user-defined <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> footer for the generated <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> document. The footer should contain everything after the last chapter. If it is left blank Doxygen will generate a standard footer.</p>
<p class="interdd">See <a class="el" href="#cfg_latex_header">LATEX_HEADER</a> for more information on how to generate a default footer and what special commands can be used inside the footer.</p>
<p class="interdd">See also section <a class="el" href="doxygen_usage.html">Doxygen usage</a> for information on how to generate the default footer that Doxygen normally uses.</p>
<p class="interdd">Note: Only use a user-defined footer if you know what you are doing!</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_latex_extra_stylesheet"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>LATEX_EXTRA_STYLESHEET</code> </dt>
<dd><a id="a240_LATEX_5FEXTRA_5FSTYLESHEET" name="a240_LATEX_5FEXTRA_5FSTYLESHEET"></a> The <code>LATEX_EXTRA_STYLESHEET</code> tag can be used to specify additional user-defined <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> style sheets that are included after the standard style sheets created by Doxygen. Using this option one can overrule certain style aspects. Doxygen will copy the style sheet files to the output directory. <dl class="section note"><dt>Note</dt><dd>The order of the extra style sheet files is of importance (e.g. the last style sheet in the list overrules the setting of the previous ones in the list).</dd></dl>
This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_latex_extra_files"></a></dd>
<dt><code>LATEX_EXTRA_FILES</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a241_LATEX_5FEXTRA_5FFILES" name="a241_LATEX_5FEXTRA_5FFILES"></a> The <code>LATEX_EXTRA_FILES</code> tag can be used to specify one or more extra images or other source files which should be copied to the <a class="el" href="#cfg_latex_output">LATEX_OUTPUT</a> output directory. Note that the files will be copied as-is; there are no commands or markers available.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_pdf_hyperlinks"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>PDF_HYPERLINKS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a242_PDF_5FHYPERLINKS" name="a242_PDF_5FHYPERLINKS"></a> If the <code>PDF_HYPERLINKS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, the <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> that is generated is prepared for conversion to PDF (using <code>ps2pdf</code> or <code>pdflatex</code>). The PDF file will contain links (just like the HTML output) instead of page references. This makes the output suitable for online browsing using a PDF viewer.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_use_pdflatex"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>USE_PDFLATEX</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a243_USE_5FPDFLATEX" name="a243_USE_5FPDFLATEX"></a> If the <code>USE_PDFLATEX</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will use the engine as specified with <a class="el" href="#cfg_latex_cmd_name">LATEX_CMD_NAME</a> to generate the PDF file directly from the <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> files. Set this option to <code>YES</code>, to get a higher quality PDF documentation. <br  />
 See also section <a class="el" href="#cfg_latex_cmd_name">LATEX_CMD_NAME</a> for selecting the engine.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_latex_batchmode"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>LATEX_BATCHMODE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a244_LATEX_5FBATCHMODE" name="a244_LATEX_5FBATCHMODE"></a> The <code>LATEX_BATCHMODE</code> tag signals the behavior of <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> in case of an error.</p>
<p class="interdd">Possible values are: <code>NO</code> same as ERROR_STOP, <code>YES</code> same as BATCH, <code>BATCH</code> In batch mode nothing is printed on the terminal, errors are scrolled as if &lt;return&gt; is hit at every error; missing files that TeX tries to input or request from keyboard input (\read on a not open input stream) cause the job to abort, <code>NON_STOP</code> In nonstop mode the diagnostic message will appear on the terminal, but there is no possibility of user interaction just like in batch mode, <code>SCROLL</code> In scroll mode, TeX will stop only for missing files to input or if keyboard input is necessary and <code>ERROR_STOP</code> In errorstop mode, TeX will stop at each error, asking for user intervention.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_latex_hide_indices"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>LATEX_HIDE_INDICES</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a245_LATEX_5FHIDE_5FINDICES" name="a245_LATEX_5FHIDE_5FINDICES"></a> If the <code>LATEX_HIDE_INDICES</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen will not include the index chapters (such as File Index, Compound Index, etc.) in the output.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_latex_bib_style"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>LATEX_BIB_STYLE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a246_LATEX_5FBIB_5FSTYLE" name="a246_LATEX_5FBIB_5FSTYLE"></a> The <code>LATEX_BIB_STYLE</code> tag can be used to specify the style to use for the bibliography, e.g. <code>plainnat</code>, or <code>ieeetr</code>. See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BibTeX">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BibTeX</a> and <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdcite">\cite</a> for more info.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>plainnat</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_latex_emoji_directory"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>LATEX_EMOJI_DIRECTORY</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a247_LATEX_5FEMOJI_5FDIRECTORY" name="a247_LATEX_5FEMOJI_5FDIRECTORY"></a> The <code>LATEX_EMOJI_DIRECTORY</code> tag is used to specify the (relative or absolute) path from which the emoji images will be read. If a relative path is entered, it will be relative to the <a class="el" href="#cfg_latex_output">LATEX_OUTPUT</a> directory. If left blank the <a class="el" href="#cfg_latex_output">LATEX_OUTPUT</a> directory will be used.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_latex">GENERATE_LATEX</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
<h1 class="doxsection"><a class="anchor" id="config_rtf"></a>
Configuration options related to the RTF output</h1>
<p><a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_rtf"></a></p><dl>
<dt><code>GENERATE_RTF</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a248_GENERATE_5FRTF" name="a248_GENERATE_5FRTF"></a> If the <code>GENERATE_RTF</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will generate RTF output. The RTF output is optimized for Word 97 and may not look too pretty with other RTF readers/editors.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_rtf_output"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>RTF_OUTPUT</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a249_RTF_5FOUTPUT" name="a249_RTF_5FOUTPUT"></a> The <code>RTF_OUTPUT</code> tag is used to specify where the RTF docs will be put. If a relative path is entered the value of <a class="el" href="#cfg_output_directory">OUTPUT_DIRECTORY</a> will be put in front of it.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default directory is: <code>rtf</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_rtf">GENERATE_RTF</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_compact_rtf"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>COMPACT_RTF</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a250_COMPACT_5FRTF" name="a250_COMPACT_5FRTF"></a> If the <code>COMPACT_RTF</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen generates more compact RTF documents. This may be useful for small projects and may help to save some trees in general.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_rtf">GENERATE_RTF</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_rtf_hyperlinks"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>RTF_HYPERLINKS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a251_RTF_5FHYPERLINKS" name="a251_RTF_5FHYPERLINKS"></a> If the <code>RTF_HYPERLINKS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, the RTF that is generated will contain hyperlink fields. The RTF file will contain links (just like the HTML output) instead of page references. This makes the output suitable for online browsing using Word or some other Word compatible readers that support those fields.</p>
<p class="interdd"><br  />
Note: WordPad (write) and others do not support links.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_rtf">GENERATE_RTF</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_rtf_stylesheet_file"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>RTF_STYLESHEET_FILE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a252_RTF_5FSTYLESHEET_5FFILE" name="a252_RTF_5FSTYLESHEET_5FFILE"></a> Load stylesheet definitions from file. Syntax is similar to Doxygen's configuration file, i.e. a series of assignments. You only have to provide replacements, missing definitions are set to their default value. <br  />
 See also section <a class="el" href="doxygen_usage.html">Doxygen usage</a> for information on how to generate the default style sheet that Doxygen normally uses.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_rtf">GENERATE_RTF</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_rtf_extensions_file"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>RTF_EXTENSIONS_FILE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a253_RTF_5FEXTENSIONS_5FFILE" name="a253_RTF_5FEXTENSIONS_5FFILE"></a> Set optional variables used in the generation of an RTF document. Syntax is similar to Doxygen's configuration file. A template extensions file can be generated using <code>doxygen -e rtf extensionFile</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_rtf">GENERATE_RTF</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_rtf_extra_files"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>RTF_EXTRA_FILES</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a254_RTF_5FEXTRA_5FFILES" name="a254_RTF_5FEXTRA_5FFILES"></a> The <code>RTF_EXTRA_FILES</code> tag can be used to specify one or more extra images or other source files which should be copied to the <a class="el" href="#cfg_rtf_output">RTF_OUTPUT</a> output directory. Note that the files will be copied as-is; there are no commands or markers available.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_rtf">GENERATE_RTF</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
<h1 class="doxsection"><a class="anchor" id="config_man"></a>
Configuration options related to the man page output</h1>
<p><a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_man"></a></p><dl>
<dt><code>GENERATE_MAN</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a255_GENERATE_5FMAN" name="a255_GENERATE_5FMAN"></a> If the <code>GENERATE_MAN</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will generate man pages for classes and files.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_man_output"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>MAN_OUTPUT</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a256_MAN_5FOUTPUT" name="a256_MAN_5FOUTPUT"></a> The <code>MAN_OUTPUT</code> tag is used to specify where the man pages will be put. If a relative path is entered the value of <a class="el" href="#cfg_output_directory">OUTPUT_DIRECTORY</a> will be put in front of it. A directory <code>man3</code> will be created inside the directory specified by <code>MAN_OUTPUT</code>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default directory is: <code>man</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_man">GENERATE_MAN</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_man_extension"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>MAN_EXTENSION</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a257_MAN_5FEXTENSION" name="a257_MAN_5FEXTENSION"></a> The <code>MAN_EXTENSION</code> tag determines the extension that is added to the generated man pages. In case the manual section does not start with a number, the number 3 is prepended. The dot (.) at the beginning of the <code>MAN_EXTENSION</code> tag is optional.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>.3</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_man">GENERATE_MAN</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_man_subdir"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>MAN_SUBDIR</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a258_MAN_5FSUBDIR" name="a258_MAN_5FSUBDIR"></a> The <code>MAN_SUBDIR</code> tag determines the name of the directory created within <code>MAN_OUTPUT</code> in which the man pages are placed. If defaults to man followed by <code>MAN_EXTENSION</code> with the initial . removed.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_man">GENERATE_MAN</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_man_links"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>MAN_LINKS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a259_MAN_5FLINKS" name="a259_MAN_5FLINKS"></a> If the <code>MAN_LINKS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> and Doxygen generates man output, then it will generate one additional man file for each entity documented in the real man page(s). These additional files only source the real man page, but without them the <code>man</code> command would be unable to find the correct page.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_man">GENERATE_MAN</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
<h1 class="doxsection"><a class="anchor" id="config_xml"></a>
Configuration options related to the XML output</h1>
<p><a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_xml"></a></p><dl>
<dt><code>GENERATE_XML</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a260_GENERATE_5FXML" name="a260_GENERATE_5FXML"></a> If the <code>GENERATE_XML</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will generate an XML file that captures the structure of the code including all documentation.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_xml_output"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>XML_OUTPUT</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a261_XML_5FOUTPUT" name="a261_XML_5FOUTPUT"></a> The <code>XML_OUTPUT</code> tag is used to specify where the XML pages will be put. If a relative path is entered the value of <a class="el" href="#cfg_output_directory">OUTPUT_DIRECTORY</a> will be put in front of it.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default directory is: <code>xml</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_xml">GENERATE_XML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_xml_programlisting"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>XML_PROGRAMLISTING</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a262_XML_5FPROGRAMLISTING" name="a262_XML_5FPROGRAMLISTING"></a> If the <code>XML_PROGRAMLISTING</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will dump the program listings (including syntax highlighting and cross-referencing information) to the XML output. Note that enabling this will significantly increase the size of the XML output.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_xml">GENERATE_XML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_xml_ns_memb_file_scope"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>XML_NS_MEMB_FILE_SCOPE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a263_XML_5FNS_5FMEMB_5FFILE_5FSCOPE" name="a263_XML_5FNS_5FMEMB_5FFILE_5FSCOPE"></a> If the <code>XML_NS_MEMB_FILE_SCOPE</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will include namespace members in file scope as well, matching the HTML output.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_xml">GENERATE_XML</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. </p>
</dd>
</dl>

If a relative path is entered the value of <a class="el" href="#cfg_output_directory">OUTPUT_DIRECTORY</a> will be put in front of it.</p>

<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_docbook">GENERATE_DOCBOOK</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. </p>

<h1 class="doxsection"><a class="anchor" id="config_autogen"></a>

Note that this feature is still experimental and incomplete at the moment.</p>

<p class="enddd"></p>
