<h1 class="doxsection"><a class="anchor" id="config_sqlite3"></a>
Configuration options related to Sqlite3 output</h1>
<p><a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_sqlite3"></a></p><dl>
<dt><code>GENERATE_SQLITE3</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a267_GENERATE_5FSQLITE3" name="a267_GENERATE_5FSQLITE3"></a> If the <code>GENERATE_SQLITE3</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> Doxygen will generate a <code>Sqlite3</code> database with symbols found by Doxygen stored in tables.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_sqlite3_output"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>SQLITE3_OUTPUT</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a268_SQLITE3_5FOUTPUT" name="a268_SQLITE3_5FOUTPUT"></a> The <code>SQLITE3_OUTPUT</code> tag is used to specify where the <code>Sqlite3</code> database will be put. If a relative path is entered the value of <a class="el" href="#cfg_output_directory">OUTPUT_DIRECTORY</a> will be put in front of it.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default directory is: <code>sqlite3</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_sqlite3">GENERATE_SQLITE3</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_sqlite3_recreate_db"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>SQLITE3_RECREATE_DB</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a269_SQLITE3_5FRECREATE_5FDB" name="a269_SQLITE3_5FRECREATE_5FDB"></a> The <code>SQLITE3_RECREATE_DB</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, the existing doxygen_sqlite3.db database file will be recreated with each Doxygen run. If set to <code>NO</code>, Doxygen will warn if a database file is already found and not modify it.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_sqlite3">GENERATE_SQLITE3</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
<h1 class="doxsection"><a class="anchor" id="config_perlmod"></a>
Configuration options related to the Perl module output</h1>
<p><a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_perlmod"></a></p><dl>
<dt><code>GENERATE_PERLMOD</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a270_GENERATE_5FPERLMOD" name="a270_GENERATE_5FPERLMOD"></a> If the <code>GENERATE_PERLMOD</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will generate a Perl module file that captures the structure of the code including all documentation. <br  />
Note that this feature is still experimental and incomplete at the moment.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_perlmod_latex"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>PERLMOD_LATEX</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a271_PERLMOD_5FLATEX" name="a271_PERLMOD_5FLATEX"></a> If the <code>PERLMOD_LATEX</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will generate the necessary <code>Makefile</code> rules, <code>Perl</code> scripts and <img class="formulaInl light-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11.png" width="34" height="13"/><img class="formulaInl dark-mode-visible" alt="$\mbox{\LaTeX}$" src="form_11_dark.png" width="34" height="13"/> code to be able to generate PDF and DVI output from the Perl module output.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_perlmod">GENERATE_PERLMOD</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_perlmod_pretty"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>PERLMOD_PRETTY</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a272_PERLMOD_5FPRETTY" name="a272_PERLMOD_5FPRETTY"></a> If the <code>PERLMOD_PRETTY</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, the Perl module output will be nicely formatted so it can be parsed by a human reader. This is useful if you want to understand what is going on. On the other hand, if this tag is set to <code>NO</code>, the size of the Perl module output will be much smaller and Perl will parse it just the same.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_perlmod">GENERATE_PERLMOD</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_perlmod_makevar_prefix"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>PERLMOD_MAKEVAR_PREFIX</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a273_PERLMOD_5FMAKEVAR_5FPREFIX" name="a273_PERLMOD_5FMAKEVAR_5FPREFIX"></a> The names of the make variables in the generated <span class="tt">doxyrules.make</span> file are prefixed with the string contained in <code>PERLMOD_MAKEVAR_PREFIX</code>. This is useful so different <span class="tt">doxyrules.make</span> files included by the same <span class="tt">Makefile</span> don't overwrite each other's variables.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_generate_perlmod">GENERATE_PERLMOD</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
<h1 class="doxsection"><a class="anchor" id="config_preprocessor"></a>
Configuration options related to the preprocessor</h1>
<p><a class="anchor" id="cfg_enable_preprocessing"></a></p><dl>
<dt><code>ENABLE_PREPROCESSING</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a274_ENABLE_5FPREPROCESSING" name="a274_ENABLE_5FPREPROCESSING"></a> If the <code>ENABLE_PREPROCESSING</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will evaluate all C-preprocessor directives found in the sources and include files.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_macro_expansion"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>MACRO_EXPANSION</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a275_MACRO_5FEXPANSION" name="a275_MACRO_5FEXPANSION"></a> If the <code>MACRO_EXPANSION</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will expand all macro names in the source code. If set to <code>NO</code>, only conditional compilation will be performed. Macro expansion can be done in a controlled way by setting <a class="el" href="#cfg_expand_only_predef">EXPAND_ONLY_PREDEF</a> to <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_enable_preprocessing">ENABLE_PREPROCESSING</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_expand_only_predef"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXPAND_ONLY_PREDEF</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a276_EXPAND_5FONLY_5FPREDEF" name="a276_EXPAND_5FONLY_5FPREDEF"></a> If the <code>EXPAND_ONLY_PREDEF</code> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_macro_expansion">MACRO_EXPANSION</a> tags are both set to <code>YES</code> then the macro expansion is limited to the macros specified with the <a class="el" href="#cfg_predefined">PREDEFINED</a> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_expand_as_defined">EXPAND_AS_DEFINED</a> tags.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_enable_preprocessing">ENABLE_PREPROCESSING</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_search_includes"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>SEARCH_INCLUDES</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a277_SEARCH_5FINCLUDES" name="a277_SEARCH_5FINCLUDES"></a> If the <code>SEARCH_INCLUDES</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, the include files in the <a class="el" href="#cfg_include_path">INCLUDE_PATH</a> will be searched if a <code>#include</code> is found.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_enable_preprocessing">ENABLE_PREPROCESSING</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_include_path"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>INCLUDE_PATH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a278_INCLUDE_5FPATH" name="a278_INCLUDE_5FPATH"></a> The <code>INCLUDE_PATH</code> tag can be used to specify one or more directories that contain include files that are not input files but should be processed by the preprocessor.</p>
<p class="interdd">Note that the <code>INCLUDE_PATH</code> is not recursive, so the setting of <a class="el" href="#cfg_recursive">RECURSIVE</a> has no effect here.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_search_includes">SEARCH_INCLUDES</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_include_file_patterns"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>INCLUDE_FILE_PATTERNS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a279_INCLUDE_5FFILE_5FPATTERNS" name="a279_INCLUDE_5FFILE_5FPATTERNS"></a> You can use the <code>INCLUDE_FILE_PATTERNS</code> tag to specify one or more wildcard patterns (like <span class="tt">*.h</span> and <span class="tt">*.hpp</span>) to filter out the header-files in the directories. If left blank, the patterns specified with <a class="el" href="#cfg_file_patterns">FILE_PATTERNS</a> will be used.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_enable_preprocessing">ENABLE_PREPROCESSING</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_predefined"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>PREDEFINED</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a280_PREDEFINED" name="a280_PREDEFINED"></a> The <code>PREDEFINED</code> tag can be used to specify one or more macro names that are defined before the preprocessor is started (similar to the <span class="tt">-D</span> option of e.g. <code>gcc</code>). The argument of the tag is a list of macros of the form: <code>name</code> or <code>name=definition</code> (no spaces). If the definition and the <code>"="</code> are omitted, <code>"=1"</code> is assumed. To prevent a macro definition from being undefined via <code>#undef</code> or recursively expanded use the <code>:=</code> operator instead of the <code>=</code> operator.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_enable_preprocessing">ENABLE_PREPROCESSING</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_expand_as_defined"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXPAND_AS_DEFINED</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a281_EXPAND_5FAS_5FDEFINED" name="a281_EXPAND_5FAS_5FDEFINED"></a> If the <a class="el" href="#cfg_macro_expansion">MACRO_EXPANSION</a> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_expand_only_predef">EXPAND_ONLY_PREDEF</a> tags are set to <code>YES</code> then this tag can be used to specify a list of macro names that should be expanded. The macro definition that is found in the sources will be used. Use the <a class="el" href="#cfg_predefined">PREDEFINED</a> tag if you want to use a different macro definition that overrules the definition found in the source code.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_enable_preprocessing">ENABLE_PREPROCESSING</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_skip_function_macros"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>SKIP_FUNCTION_MACROS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a282_SKIP_5FFUNCTION_5FMACROS" name="a282_SKIP_5FFUNCTION_5FMACROS"></a> If the <code>SKIP_FUNCTION_MACROS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen's preprocessor will remove all references to function-like macros that are alone on a line, have an all uppercase name, and do not end with a semicolon. Such function macros are typically used for boiler-plate code, and will confuse the parser if not removed.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_enable_preprocessing">ENABLE_PREPROCESSING</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. </p>
</dd>
</dl>
<h1 class="doxsection"><a class="anchor" id="config_external"></a>
Configuration options related to external references</h1>
<p><a class="anchor" id="cfg_tagfiles"></a></p><dl>
<dt><code>TAGFILES</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a283_TAGFILES" name="a283_TAGFILES"></a> The <code>TAGFILES</code> tag can be used to specify one or more tag files.</p>
<p class="interdd">For each tag file the location of the external documentation should be added. The format of a tag file without this location is as follows: </p><pre class="fragment">  TAGFILES = file1 file2 ...
</pre><p> Adding location for the tag files is done as follows: </p><pre class="fragment">  TAGFILES = file1=loc1 "file2 = loc2" ...
</pre><p> where <span class="tt">loc1</span> and <span class="tt">loc2</span> can be relative or absolute paths or URLs. See the section <a class="el" href="external.html">Linking to external documentation</a> for more information about the use of tag files.</p>
<dl class="section note"><dt>Note</dt><dd>Each tag file must have a unique name (where the name does <em>NOT</em> include the path). If a tag file is not located in the directory in which Doxygen is run, you must also specify the path to the tagfile here.</dd></dl>
<p><a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_tagfile"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>GENERATE_TAGFILE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a284_GENERATE_5FTAGFILE" name="a284_GENERATE_5FTAGFILE"></a> When a file name is specified after <code>GENERATE_TAGFILE</code>, Doxygen will create a tag file that is based on the input files it reads. See section <a class="el" href="external.html">Linking to external documentation</a> for more information about the usage of tag files.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_allexternals"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>ALLEXTERNALS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a285_ALLEXTERNALS" name="a285_ALLEXTERNALS"></a> If the <code>ALLEXTERNALS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, all external classes and namespaces will be listed in the class and namespace index. If set to <code>NO</code>, only the inherited external classes will be listed.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_external_groups"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXTERNAL_GROUPS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a286_EXTERNAL_5FGROUPS" name="a286_EXTERNAL_5FGROUPS"></a> If the <code>EXTERNAL_GROUPS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, all external groups will be listed in the topic index. If set to <code>NO</code>, only the current project's groups will be listed.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_external_pages"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>EXTERNAL_PAGES</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a287_EXTERNAL_5FPAGES" name="a287_EXTERNAL_5FPAGES"></a> If the <code>EXTERNAL_PAGES</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, all external pages will be listed in the related pages index. If set to <code>NO</code>, only the current project's pages will be listed.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<h1 class="doxsection"><a class="anchor" id="config_dot"></a>
Configuration options related to diagram generator tools</h1>
<p><a class="anchor" id="cfg_hide_undoc_relations"></a></p><dl>
<dt><code>HIDE_UNDOC_RELATIONS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a288_HIDE_5FUNDOC_5FRELATIONS" name="a288_HIDE_5FUNDOC_5FRELATIONS"></a> If set to <code>YES</code> the inheritance and collaboration graphs will hide inheritance and usage relations if the target is undocumented or is not a class.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_have_dot"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>HAVE_DOT</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a289_HAVE_5FDOT" name="a289_HAVE_5FDOT"></a> If you set the <code>HAVE_DOT</code> tag to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen will assume the <code>dot</code> tool is available from the <code>path</code>. This tool is part of <a href="https://www.graphviz.org/">Graphviz</a>, a graph visualization toolkit from AT&amp;T and Lucent Bell Labs. The other options in this section have no effect if this option is set to <code>NO</code> </p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_dot_num_threads"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOT_NUM_THREADS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a290_DOT_5FNUM_5FTHREADS" name="a290_DOT_5FNUM_5FTHREADS"></a> The <code>DOT_NUM_THREADS</code> specifies the number of <code>dot</code> invocations Doxygen is allowed to run in parallel. When set to <code>0</code> Doxygen will base this on the number of processors available in the system. You can set it explicitly to a value larger than 0 to get control over the balance between CPU load and processing speed.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>0</code>, maximum value: <code>32</code>, default value: <code>0</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_dot_common_attr"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOT_COMMON_ATTR</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a291_DOT_5FCOMMON_5FATTR" name="a291_DOT_5FCOMMON_5FATTR"></a> <code>DOT_COMMON_ATTR</code> is common attributes for nodes, edges and labels of subgraphs. When you want a differently looking font in the dot files that Doxygen generates you can specify fontname, fontcolor and fontsize attributes. For details please see <a href="https://graphviz.org/doc/info/attrs.html">Node, Edge and Graph Attributes specification</a> You need to make sure dot is able to find the font, which can be done by putting it in a standard location or by setting the <code>DOTFONTPATH</code> environment variable or by setting <a class="el" href="#cfg_dot_fontpath">DOT_FONTPATH</a> to the directory containing the font. Default graphviz fontsize is 14.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>fontname=Helvetica,fontsize=10</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_dot_edge_attr"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOT_EDGE_ATTR</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a292_DOT_5FEDGE_5FATTR" name="a292_DOT_5FEDGE_5FATTR"></a> <code>DOT_EDGE_ATTR</code> is concatenated with <a class="el" href="#cfg_dot_common_attr">DOT_COMMON_ATTR</a>. For elegant style you can add 'arrowhead=open, arrowtail=open, arrowsize=0.5'. <a href="https://graphviz.org/doc/info/arrows.html">Complete documentation about arrows shapes.</a></p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>labelfontname=Helvetica,labelfontsize=10</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_dot_node_attr"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOT_NODE_ATTR</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a293_DOT_5FNODE_5FATTR" name="a293_DOT_5FNODE_5FATTR"></a> <code>DOT_NODE_ATTR</code> is concatenated with <a class="el" href="#cfg_dot_common_attr">DOT_COMMON_ATTR</a>. For view without boxes around nodes set 'shape=plain' or 'shape=plaintext' <a href="https://www.graphviz.org/doc/info/shapes.html">Shapes specification</a></p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>shape=box,height=0.2,width=0.4</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_dot_fontpath"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOT_FONTPATH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a294_DOT_5FFONTPATH" name="a294_DOT_5FFONTPATH"></a> You can set the path where <code>dot</code> can find font specified with fontname in <a class="el" href="#cfg_dot_common_attr">DOT_COMMON_ATTR</a> and others dot attributes.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_class_graph"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>CLASS_GRAPH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a295_CLASS_5FGRAPH" name="a295_CLASS_5FGRAPH"></a> If the <code>CLASS_GRAPH</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> or <code>GRAPH</code> or <code>BUILTIN</code> then Doxygen will generate a graph for each documented class showing the direct and indirect inheritance relations. In case the <code>CLASS_GRAPH</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> or <code>GRAPH</code> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is enabled as well, then <span class="tt">dot</span> will be used to draw the graph. In case the <code>CLASS_GRAPH</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is disabled or if the <code>CLASS_GRAPH</code> tag is set to <code>BUILTIN</code>, then the built-in generator will be used. If the <code>CLASS_GRAPH</code> tag is set to <code>TEXT</code> the direct and indirect inheritance relations will be shown as texts / links. Explicit enabling an inheritance graph or choosing a different representation for an inheritance graph of a specific class, can be accomplished by means of the command <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdinheritancegraph">\inheritancegraph</a>. Disabling an inheritance graph can be accomplished by means of the command <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdhideinheritancegraph">\hideinheritancegraph</a>.</p>
<p class="interdd">Possible values are: <code>NO</code>, <code>YES</code>, <code>TEXT</code>, <code>GRAPH</code> and <code>BUILTIN</code>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_collaboration_graph"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>COLLABORATION_GRAPH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a296_COLLABORATION_5FGRAPH" name="a296_COLLABORATION_5FGRAPH"></a> If the <code>COLLABORATION_GRAPH</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen will generate a graph for each documented class showing the direct and indirect implementation dependencies (inheritance, containment, and class references variables) of the class with other documented classes. Explicit enabling a collaboration graph, when <code>COLLABORATION_GRAPH</code> is set to <code>NO</code>, can be accomplished by means of the command <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdcollaborationgraph">\collaborationgraph</a>. Disabling a collaboration graph can be accomplished by means of the command <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdhidecollaborationgraph">\hidecollaborationgraph</a>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_group_graphs"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>GROUP_GRAPHS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a297_GROUP_5FGRAPHS" name="a297_GROUP_5FGRAPHS"></a> If the <code>GROUP_GRAPHS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen will generate a graph for groups, showing the direct groups dependencies. Explicit enabling a group dependency graph, when <code>GROUP_GRAPHS</code> is set to <code>NO</code>, can be accomplished by means of the command <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdgroupgraph">\groupgraph</a>. Disabling a directory graph can be accomplished by means of the command <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdhidegroupgraph">\hidegroupgraph</a>.</p>
<p class="interdd">See also the chapter <a class="el" href="grouping.html">Grouping</a> in the manual.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_uml_look"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>UML_LOOK</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a298_UML_5FLOOK" name="a298_UML_5FLOOK"></a> If the <code>UML_LOOK</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will generate inheritance and collaboration diagrams in a style similar to the OMG's Unified Modeling Language.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_uml_limit_num_fields"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>UML_LIMIT_NUM_FIELDS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a299_UML_5FLIMIT_5FNUM_5FFIELDS" name="a299_UML_5FLIMIT_5FNUM_5FFIELDS"></a> If the <a class="el" href="#cfg_uml_look">UML_LOOK</a> tag is enabled, the fields and methods are shown inside the class node. If there are many fields or methods and many nodes the graph may become too big to be useful. The <code>UML_LIMIT_NUM_FIELDS</code> threshold limits the number of items for each type to make the size more manageable. Set this to 0 for no limit. Note that the threshold may be exceeded by 50% before the limit is enforced. So when you set the threshold to 10, up to 15 fields may appear, but if the number exceeds 15, the total amount of fields shown is limited to 10.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>0</code>, maximum value: <code>100</code>, default value: <code>10</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_uml_look">UML_LOOK</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_uml_max_edge_labels"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>UML_MAX_EDGE_LABELS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a300_UML_5FMAX_5FEDGE_5FLABELS" name="a300_UML_5FMAX_5FEDGE_5FLABELS"></a> If the <a class="el" href="#cfg_uml_look">UML_LOOK</a> tag is enabled, field labels are shown along the edge between two class nodes. If there are many fields and many nodes the graph may become too cluttered. The <code>UML_MAX_EDGE_LABELS</code> threshold limits the number of items to make the size more manageable. Set this to 0 for no limit.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>0</code>, maximum value: <code>100</code>, default value: <code>10</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_uml_look">UML_LOOK</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_dot_uml_details"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOT_UML_DETAILS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a301_DOT_5FUML_5FDETAILS" name="a301_DOT_5FUML_5FDETAILS"></a> If the <code>DOT_UML_DETAILS</code> tag is set to <code>NO</code>, Doxygen will show attributes and methods without types and arguments in the UML graphs. If the <code>DOT_UML_DETAILS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will add type and arguments for attributes and methods in the UML graphs. If the <code>DOT_UML_DETAILS</code> tag is set to <code>NONE</code>, Doxygen will not generate fields with class member information in the UML graphs. The class diagrams will look similar to the default class diagrams but using UML notation for the relationships.</p>
<p class="interdd">Possible values are: <code>NO</code>, <code>YES</code> and <code>NONE</code>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_uml_look">UML_LOOK</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_dot_wrap_threshold"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOT_WRAP_THRESHOLD</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a302_DOT_5FWRAP_5FTHRESHOLD" name="a302_DOT_5FWRAP_5FTHRESHOLD"></a> The <code>DOT_WRAP_THRESHOLD</code> tag can be used to set the maximum number of characters to display on a single line. If the actual line length exceeds this threshold significantly it will be wrapped across multiple lines. Some heuristics are applied to avoid ugly line breaks.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>0</code>, maximum value: <code>1000</code>, default value: <code>17</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_template_relations"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>TEMPLATE_RELATIONS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a303_TEMPLATE_5FRELATIONS" name="a303_TEMPLATE_5FRELATIONS"></a> If the <code>TEMPLATE_RELATIONS</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then the inheritance and collaboration graphs will show the relations between templates and their instances.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_include_graph"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>INCLUDE_GRAPH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a304_INCLUDE_5FGRAPH" name="a304_INCLUDE_5FGRAPH"></a> If the <code>INCLUDE_GRAPH</code>, <a class="el" href="#cfg_enable_preprocessing">ENABLE_PREPROCESSING</a> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_search_includes">SEARCH_INCLUDES</a> tags are set to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen will generate a graph for each documented file showing the direct and indirect include dependencies of the file with other documented files. Explicit enabling an include graph, when <code>INCLUDE_GRAPH</code> is is set to <code>NO</code>, can be accomplished by means of the command <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdincludegraph">\includegraph</a>. Disabling an include graph can be accomplished by means of the command <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdhideincludegraph">\hideincludegraph</a>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_included_by_graph"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>INCLUDED_BY_GRAPH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a305_INCLUDED_5FBY_5FGRAPH" name="a305_INCLUDED_5FBY_5FGRAPH"></a> If the <code>INCLUDED_BY_GRAPH</code>, <a class="el" href="#cfg_enable_preprocessing">ENABLE_PREPROCESSING</a> and <a class="el" href="#cfg_search_includes">SEARCH_INCLUDES</a> tags are set to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen will generate a graph for each documented file showing the direct and indirect include dependencies of the file with other documented files. Explicit enabling an included by graph, when <code>INCLUDED_BY_GRAPH</code> is set to <code>NO</code>, can be accomplished by means of the command <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdincludedbygraph">\includedbygraph</a>. Disabling an included by graph can be accomplished by means of the command <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdhideincludedbygraph">\hideincludedbygraph</a>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_call_graph"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>CALL_GRAPH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a306_CALL_5FGRAPH" name="a306_CALL_5FGRAPH"></a> If the <code>CALL_GRAPH</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen will generate a call dependency graph for every global function or class method. <br  />
Note that enabling this option will significantly increase the time of a run. So in most cases it will be better to enable call graphs for selected functions only using the <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdcallgraph">\callgraph</a> command. Disabling a call graph can be accomplished by means of the command <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdhidecallgraph">\hidecallgraph</a>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_caller_graph"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>CALLER_GRAPH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a307_CALLER_5FGRAPH" name="a307_CALLER_5FGRAPH"></a> If the <code>CALLER_GRAPH</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen will generate a caller dependency graph for every global function or class method. <br  />
Note that enabling this option will significantly increase the time of a run. So in most cases it will be better to enable caller graphs for selected functions only using the <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdcallergraph">\callergraph</a> command. Disabling a caller graph can be accomplished by means of the command <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdhidecallergraph">\hidecallergraph</a>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_graphical_hierarchy"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>GRAPHICAL_HIERARCHY</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a308_GRAPHICAL_5FHIERARCHY" name="a308_GRAPHICAL_5FHIERARCHY"></a> If the <code>GRAPHICAL_HIERARCHY</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen will graphical hierarchy of all classes instead of a textual one.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_directory_graph"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DIRECTORY_GRAPH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a309_DIRECTORY_5FGRAPH" name="a309_DIRECTORY_5FGRAPH"></a> If the <code>DIRECTORY_GRAPH</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> then Doxygen will show the dependencies a directory has on other directories in a graphical way. The dependency relations are determined by the <code>#include</code> relations between the files in the directories. Explicit enabling a directory graph, when <code>DIRECTORY_GRAPH</code> is set to <code>NO</code>, can be accomplished by means of the command <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmddirectorygraph">\directorygraph</a>. Disabling a directory graph can be accomplished by means of the command <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdhidedirectorygraph">\hidedirectorygraph</a>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_dir_graph_max_depth"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DIR_GRAPH_MAX_DEPTH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a310_DIR_5FGRAPH_5FMAX_5FDEPTH" name="a310_DIR_5FGRAPH_5FMAX_5FDEPTH"></a> The <code>DIR_GRAPH_MAX_DEPTH</code> tag can be used to limit the maximum number of levels of child directories generated in directory dependency graphs by <code>dot</code>.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>1</code>, maximum value: <code>25</code>, default value: <code>1</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_directory_graph">DIRECTORY_GRAPH</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_dot_image_format"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOT_IMAGE_FORMAT</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a311_DOT_5FIMAGE_5FFORMAT" name="a311_DOT_5FIMAGE_5FFORMAT"></a> The <code>DOT_IMAGE_FORMAT</code> tag can be used to set the image format of the images generated by <code>dot</code>. For an explanation of the image formats see the section output formats in the documentation of the <code>dot</code> tool (<a href="https://www.graphviz.org/">Graphviz</a>). <br  />
Note the formats <span class="tt">svg:cairo</span> and <span class="tt">svg:cairo:cairo</span> cannot be used in combination with <a class="el" href="#cfg_interactive_svg">INTERACTIVE_SVG</a> (the <a class="el" href="#cfg_interactive_svg">INTERACTIVE_SVG</a> will be set to <span class="tt">NO</span>).</p>
<p class="interdd">Possible values are: <code>png</code>, <code>jpg</code>, <code>gif</code>, <code>svg</code>, <code>png:gd</code>, <code>png:gd:gd</code>, <code>png:cairo</code>, <code>png:cairo:gd</code>, <code>png:cairo:cairo</code>, <code>png:cairo:gdiplus</code>, <code>png:gdiplus</code>, <code>png:gdiplus:gdiplus</code>, <code>svg:cairo</code>, <code>svg:cairo:cairo</code>, <code>svg:svg</code>, <code>svg:svg:core</code>, <code>gif:cairo</code>, <code>gif:cairo:gd</code>, <code>gif:cairo:gdiplus</code>, <code>gif:gdiplus</code>, <code>gif:gdiplus:gdiplus</code>, <code>gif:gd</code>, <code>gif:gd:gd</code>, <code>jpg:cairo</code>, <code>jpg:cairo:gd</code>, <code>jpg:cairo:gdiplus</code>, <code>jpg:gd</code>, <code>jpg:gd:gd</code>, <code>jpg:gdiplus</code> and <code>jpg:gdiplus:gdiplus</code>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>png</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_interactive_svg"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>INTERACTIVE_SVG</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a312_INTERACTIVE_5FSVG" name="a312_INTERACTIVE_5FSVG"></a> If <a class="el" href="#cfg_dot_image_format">DOT_IMAGE_FORMAT</a> is set to <span class="tt">svg</span> or <span class="tt">svg:svg</span> or <span class="tt">svg:svg:core</span>, then this option can be set to <code>YES</code> to enable generation of interactive SVG images that allow zooming and panning. <br  />
Note that this requires a modern browser other than Internet Explorer. Tested and working are Firefox, Chrome, Safari, and Opera. <br  />
Note This option will be automatically disabled when <a class="el" href="#cfg_dot_image_format">DOT_IMAGE_FORMAT</a> is set to <span class="tt">svg:cairo</span> or <span class="tt">svg:cairo:cairo</span>.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_dot_path"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOT_PATH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a313_DOT_5FPATH" name="a313_DOT_5FPATH"></a> The <code>DOT_PATH</code> tag can be used to specify the path where the <code>dot</code> tool can be found. If left blank, it is assumed the <code>dot</code> tool can be found in the <code>path</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_dotfile_dirs"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOTFILE_DIRS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a314_DOTFILE_5FDIRS" name="a314_DOTFILE_5FDIRS"></a> The <code>DOTFILE_DIRS</code> tag can be used to specify one or more directories that contain dot files that are included in the documentation (see the <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmddotfile">\dotfile</a> command).</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_dia_path"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DIA_PATH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a315_DIA_5FPATH" name="a315_DIA_5FPATH"></a> You can include diagrams made with dia in Doxygen documentation. Doxygen will then run dia to produce the diagram and insert it in the documentation. The DIA_PATH tag allows you to specify the directory where the dia binary resides. If left empty dia is assumed to be found in the default search path.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_diafile_dirs"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DIAFILE_DIRS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a316_DIAFILE_5FDIRS" name="a316_DIAFILE_5FDIRS"></a> The <code>DIAFILE_DIRS</code> tag can be used to specify one or more directories that contain dia files that are included in the documentation (see the <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmddiafile">\diafile</a> command).</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_plantuml_jar_path"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>PLANTUML_JAR_PATH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a317_PLANTUML_5FJAR_5FPATH" name="a317_PLANTUML_5FJAR_5FPATH"></a> When using PlantUML, the <code>PLANTUML_JAR_PATH</code> tag should be used to specify the path where java can find the <code>plantuml.jar</code> file or to the filename of <code>jar</code> file to be used. If left blank, it is assumed PlantUML is not used or called during a preprocessing step. Doxygen will generate a warning when it encounters a <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdstartuml">\startuml</a> command in this case and will not generate output for the diagram.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_plantuml_cfg_file"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>PLANTUML_CFG_FILE</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a318_PLANTUML_5FCFG_5FFILE" name="a318_PLANTUML_5FCFG_5FFILE"></a> When using PlantUML, the <code>PLANTUML_CFG_FILE</code> tag can be used to specify a configuration file for PlantUML.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_plantuml_include_path"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>PLANTUML_INCLUDE_PATH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a319_PLANTUML_5FINCLUDE_5FPATH" name="a319_PLANTUML_5FINCLUDE_5FPATH"></a> When using PlantUML, the specified paths are searched for files specified by the <code>!include</code> statement in a PlantUML block.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_plantumlfile_dirs"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>PLANTUMLFILE_DIRS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a320_PLANTUMLFILE_5FDIRS" name="a320_PLANTUMLFILE_5FDIRS"></a> The <code>PLANTUMLFILE_DIRS</code> tag can be used to specify one or more directories that contain PlantUml files that are included in the documentation (see the <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdplantumlfile">\plantumlfile</a> command).</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_dot_graph_max_nodes"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOT_GRAPH_MAX_NODES</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a321_DOT_5FGRAPH_5FMAX_5FNODES" name="a321_DOT_5FGRAPH_5FMAX_5FNODES"></a> The <code>DOT_GRAPH_MAX_NODES</code> tag can be used to set the maximum number of nodes that will be shown in the graph. If the number of nodes in a graph becomes larger than this value, Doxygen will truncate the graph, which is visualized by representing a node as a red box. Note that if the number of direct children of the root node in a graph is already larger than <code>DOT_GRAPH_MAX_NODES</code> then the graph will not be shown at all. Also note that the size of a graph can be further restricted by <a class="el" href="#cfg_max_dot_graph_depth">MAX_DOT_GRAPH_DEPTH</a>.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>0</code>, maximum value: <code>10000</code>, default value: <code>50</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_max_dot_graph_depth"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>MAX_DOT_GRAPH_DEPTH</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a322_MAX_5FDOT_5FGRAPH_5FDEPTH" name="a322_MAX_5FDOT_5FGRAPH_5FDEPTH"></a> The <code>MAX_DOT_GRAPH_DEPTH</code> tag can be used to set the maximum depth of the graphs generated by <code>dot</code>. A depth value of 3 means that only nodes reachable from the root by following a path via at most 3 edges will be shown. Nodes that lay further from the root node will be omitted. Note that setting this option to 1 or 2 may greatly reduce the computation time needed for large code bases. Also note that the size of a graph can be further restricted by <a class="el" href="#cfg_dot_graph_max_nodes">DOT_GRAPH_MAX_NODES</a>. Using a depth of 0 means no depth restriction.</p>
<p class="interdd">Minimum value: <code>0</code>, maximum value: <code>1000</code>, default value: <code>0</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_dot_multi_targets"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOT_MULTI_TARGETS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a323_DOT_5FMULTI_5FTARGETS" name="a323_DOT_5FMULTI_5FTARGETS"></a> Set the <code>DOT_MULTI_TARGETS</code> tag to <code>YES</code> to allow dot to generate multiple output files in one run (i.e. multiple -o and -T options on the command line). This makes <code>dot</code> run faster, but since only newer versions of <code>dot</code> (&gt;1.8.10) support this, this feature is disabled by default.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>NO</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_generate_legend"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>GENERATE_LEGEND</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a324_GENERATE_5FLEGEND" name="a324_GENERATE_5FLEGEND"></a> If the <code>GENERATE_LEGEND</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code> Doxygen will generate a legend page explaining the meaning of the various boxes and arrows in the dot generated graphs. </p><dl class="section note"><dt>Note</dt><dd>This tag requires that <a class="el" href="#cfg_uml_look">UML_LOOK</a> isn't set, i.e. the Doxygen internal graphical representation for inheritance and collaboration diagrams is used.</dd></dl>
<p>The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd">This tag requires that the tag <a class="el" href="#cfg_have_dot">HAVE_DOT</a> is set to <code>YES</code>. <a class="anchor" id="cfg_dot_cleanup"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>DOT_CLEANUP</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a325_DOT_5FCLEANUP" name="a325_DOT_5FCLEANUP"></a> If the <code>DOT_CLEANUP</code> tag is set to <code>YES</code>, Doxygen will remove the intermediate files that are used to generate the various graphs. <br  />
Note: This setting is not only used for dot files but also for msc temporary files.</p>
<p class="interdd">The default value is: <code>YES</code>.</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_mscgen_tool"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>MSCGEN_TOOL</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a326_MSCGEN_5FTOOL" name="a326_MSCGEN_5FTOOL"></a> You can define message sequence charts within Doxygen comments using the <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdmsc">\msc</a> command. If the <code>MSCGEN_TOOL</code> tag is left empty (the default), then Doxygen will use a built-in version of mscgen tool to produce the charts. Alternatively, the <code>MSCGEN_TOOL</code> tag can also specify the name an external tool. For instance, specifying <span class="tt">prog</span> as the value, Doxygen will call the tool as <span class="tt">prog -T &lt;outfile_format&gt; -o &lt;outputfile&gt; &lt;inputfile&gt;</span>. The external tool should support output file formats "png", "eps", "svg", and "ismap".</p>
<p class="enddd"><a class="anchor" id="cfg_mscfile_dirs"></a></p>
</dd>
<dt><code>MSCFILE_DIRS</code> </dt>
<dd><p class="startdd"><a id="a327_MSCFILE_5FDIRS" name="a327_MSCFILE_5FDIRS"></a> The <code>MSCFILE_DIRS</code> tag can be used to specify one or more directories that contain msc files that are included in the documentation (see the <a class="el" href="commands.html#cmdmscfile">\mscfile</a> command).</p>
<p class="enddd"></p>
</dd>
</dl>
<h1 class="doxsection"><a class="anchor" id="config_examples"></a>
Examples</h1>
<p>Suppose you have a simple project consisting of two files: a source file <code>example.cc</code> and a header file <code>example.h</code>. Then a minimal configuration file is as simple as: </p><pre class="fragment">INPUT            = example.cc example.h
</pre><p>Assuming the example makes use of Qt classes and <code>perl</code> is located in <code>/usr/bin</code>, a more realistic configuration file would be: </p><pre class="fragment">PROJECT_NAME     = Example
INPUT            = example.cc example.h
WARNINGS         = YES
TAGFILES         = qt.tag
SEARCHENGINE     = NO
</pre><p>To generate the documentation for the <a href="https://sourceforge.net/projects/qdbttabular/">QdbtTabular</a> package I have used the following configuration file: </p><pre class="fragment">PROJECT_NAME     = QdbtTabular
OUTPUT_DIRECTORY = html
WARNINGS         = YES
INPUT            = examples/examples.doc src
FILE_PATTERNS    = *.cc *.h
INCLUDE_PATH     = examples
TAGFILES         = qt.tag
SEARCHENGINE     = YES
</pre><p>To regenerate the Qt-1.44 documentation from the sources, you could use the following configuration file: </p><pre class="fragment">PROJECT_NAME         = Qt
OUTPUT_DIRECTORY     = qt_docs
HIDE_UNDOC_MEMBERS   = YES
HIDE_UNDOC_CLASSES   = YES
ENABLE_PREPROCESSING = YES
MACRO_EXPANSION      = YES
EXPAND_ONLY_PREDEF   = YES
SEARCH_INCLUDES      = YES
FULL_PATH_NAMES      = YES
STRIP_FROM_PATH      = $(QTDIR)/
PREDEFINED           = USE_TEMPLATECLASS Q_EXPORT= \
                       QArrayT:=QArray \
                       QListT:=QList \
                       QDictT:=QDict \
                       QQueueT:=QQueue \
                       QVectorT:=QVector \
                       QPtrDictT:=QPtrDict \
                       QIntDictT:=QIntDict \
                       QStackT:=QStack \
                       QDictIteratorT:=QDictIterator \
                       QListIteratorT:=QListIterator \
                       QCacheT:=QCache \
                       QCacheIteratorT:=QCacheIterator \
                       QIntCacheT:=QIntCache \
                       QIntCacheIteratorT:=QIntCacheIterator \
                       QIntDictIteratorT:=QIntDictIterator \
                       QPtrDictIteratorT:=QPtrDictIterator
INPUT                = $(QTDIR)/doc \
                       $(QTDIR)/src/widgets \
                       $(QTDIR)/src/kernel \
                       $(QTDIR)/src/dialogs \
                       $(QTDIR)/src/tools
FILE_PATTERNS        = *.cpp *.h q*.doc
INCLUDE_PATH         = $(QTDIR)/include
RECURSIVE            = YES
</pre><p>For the Qt-2.1 sources I recommend to use the following settings: </p><pre class="fragment">PROJECT_NAME          = Qt
PROJECT_NUMBER        = 2.1
HIDE_UNDOC_MEMBERS    = YES
HIDE_UNDOC_CLASSES    = YES
SOURCE_BROWSER        = YES
INPUT                 = $(QTDIR)/src
FILE_PATTERNS         = *.cpp *.h q*.doc
RECURSIVE             = YES
EXCLUDE_PATTERNS      = *codec.cpp moc_* */compat/* */3rdparty/*
ALPHABETICAL_INDEX    = YES
IGNORE_PREFIX         = Q
ENABLE_PREPROCESSING  = YES
MACRO_EXPANSION       = YES
INCLUDE_PATH          = $(QTDIR)/include
PREDEFINED            = Q_PROPERTY(x)= \
                        Q_OVERRIDE(x)= \
                        Q_EXPORT= \
                        Q_ENUMS(x)= \
                        "QT_STATIC_CONST=static const " \
                        _WS_X11_ \
                        INCLUDE_MENUITEM_DEF
EXPAND_ONLY_PREDEF    = YES
EXPAND_AS_DEFINED     = Q_OBJECT_FAKE Q_OBJECT ACTIVATE_SIGNAL_WITH_PARAM \
                        Q_VARIANT_AS
</pre><p>Here Doxygen's preprocessor is used to substitute some macro names that are normally substituted by the C preprocessor, but without doing full macro expansion.</p>
<p> 
Go to the <a href="commands.html">next</a> section or return to the
 <a href="index.html">index</a>.
 </p>
